Restraint in the form of belt fixation or forced medication may be necessary when patients are severely psychotic.
It can happen that patients at Sikringen are fixed for days or weeks to a bed with a belt, hand and foot straps and gloves. But at Sikringen, 'upward forced fixation' is used as far as possible, where the patient can be together with straps on the hands and feet, so that he or she cannot hit or kick out at employees or fellow patients.
Upright fixation requires permission from a special council of six experts under the Norwegian Patient Safety Authority.
- For the patient, it is a less invasive remedy and prevents the damage that can come from prolonged fixation and isolation in a living room. We only use it for patients who can be together and the experiences are good. The patients are happy about it, and no one has complained about it for ten years, explains chief physician Per Balling.
As soon as the patient is in his own room, the straps are removed.
The fuse in Slagelse
Read more about
The most dangerous fuse
patients,
the staff
, who looks after them and a
sentenced to death
, which the doctors think should be discharged.
Abdulle Ahmed has been at Sikringen for 20 years for a few punches

title: Maiken har tabu-fantasier
subtitle: Kinky fantasier om tvangssex er udbredte blandt kvinder. Her fortæller 28-årige Maiken om sine 'forbudte' lyster
body:
Inden du læser nedenstående, kommer vi lige med denne disclaimer:
Overgrebs- og voldtægtsfantasier er fantasier. Og således ikke udtryk for, at man vil opleve det i virkeligheden.
Arkivartikel
28-årige Maiken fra Jylland vil ikke sige, at hun skammer sig over sin voldtægtsfantasi:
- Men det er bestemt ikke den første, jeg deler med folk.
Og fantasien, som hun bruger nu og da under onani, er da også lidt voldsom.
- Typisk handler den om, at en mand bryder ind i min lejlighed, mens jeg ligger og sover, og tvinger mig til seksuelle udskejelser. Mere ofte end ikke bliver jeg også ‘drugged’ af et eller andet under selve akten, så jeg ikke kan gøre modstand.
- Jeg lægger i fantasien ikke mærke til så meget, der sker, men er pinligt opmærksom på, at jeg ikke har noget valg, siger Maiken, der er webmaster til daglig.
Eksperimenter
Maiken, der har et rigt og varieret sexliv med mange eksperimenter til hverdag - fra analsex til swingersex - fortæller også, at hun aldrig sætter ansigt på manden i fantasien.
Og hun har da heller ikke lyst til at prøve den - i modsætning til mange andre af sine fantasier.
- Jeg kunne ikke finde på at udleve denne, da jeg i realiteten ikke har lyst til at have så lidt kontrol i virkeligheden. Hvilket er pudsigt, for samtidig vil jeg sige, at den er et udtryk for en trang til ikke at være i kontrol - at jeg har behov for, at nogen andre tager mine valg for mig og dermed bestemmer over mig.
Videnskab
At fantasere om at blive tvunget til sex er udbredt, især blandt kvinder, men også hos mænd. Man kan kalde dem voldtægtsfantasier, og de handler i bund og grund om at blive taget mod sin vilje.
Men hvad handler de egentlig om, og hvad kendetegner kvinder, som nyder dem?
Det har den amerikanske sexforsker Justin Lehmiller set nærmere på. Til sin bog ‘Tell Me What You Want’ interviewede han 4000 amerikanere om deres sexfantasier.
Her fremgår det, at 61 procent af kvinder har fantaseret om tvangssex, mens hver fjerde gør det ofte.
54 procent af mændene har fantaseret om at blive tvunget til sex, mens cirka hver tiende gør det ofte.
Vil gerne
Så uanset køn ser det ud til, at de fleste har haft disse overgrebsfantasier, mens især flere kvinder har dem oftere. Og folk beskriver dem ofte som ‘noget jeg inderst inde gerne ville have.'
Hvilket er ganske logisk, i og med man jo selv styrer fantasien (men altså ingen ønsker har om at leve den ud i virkelighedens verden).
Psykologen Lehmiller giver bud på, hvor fantasierne kommer fra, og hvad de betyder. Han fik nemlig også deltagerne til at udfylde spørgeskemaer, der viser deres personlighedstræk. Og således fandt han ud af, at der var visse interessante sammenhænge mellem personligheden og hyppige voldtægtsfantasier:
Folk, der generelt har en livlig fantasi og meldte om mange sexfantasier, havde større sandsynlighed for også at fantasere om tvangssex. Det indikerer, at for nogle er disse fantasier blot et udtryk for, at de har en livlig fantasi. De har en tendens til at have en stor variation i deres fantasier, fordi de har en livlig fantasi. Ikke ulig Maiken, som udtaler sig herover.
Personer med en socio-seksuel orientering (åben over for uforpligtende sex) har flere fantasier om tvungen sex. Disse fantasier er altså udbredt hos folk, der kan skelne mellem sex og følelser.
Folk med en såkaldt
sensation seeking
personlighed har flere voldtægtsfantasier. Den type forlystelsessyge personer søger gerne nye stimuli i og uden for sengen. Tvangssexfantasier ser således ud til at appellere til folk, som har ekstra brug for seksuelle kicks.
Personer med mange voldtægtsfantasier havde også flere BDSM-fantasier generelt, hvilket kan indikere, at de er udtryk for en generel interesse i BDSM.
Overgreb
Derudover observerede Justin Lehmiller nogle andre sammenhænge, som dog ikke var så udtalte om de ovennævnte.
Personer med personlige erfaringer med overgreb havde også flere voldtægtsfantasier. Ifølge Lehmiller var det dog ikke en markant korrelation,  og mange andre studier har da også peget på, at der ikke er nogen sammenhæng.
Ikke desto mindre vover han pelsen og siger, at for nogle overgrebsofre kan tvangssexfantasier være en måde at tage kontrol over tidligere oplevelser, hvor de netop ikke havde kontrol.
Ydermere var der også en svag korrelation mellem tvangssexfantasier og personer med lavt selvværd og tilknytningsproblemer i form af overdreven frygt for at blive forladt. Den lille sammenhæng kan udtrykkes sådan: ‘Endelig er der en, som vil have mig så meget, at han tvinger mig til det.’
Alt i alt betyder det, at voldtægtsfantasier betyder noget forskelligt fra person til person - og så er de først og fremmest udtryk for, at vedkommende nok har en livlig fantasi og brug for mange og varierede seksuelle kicks og sikkert er glad for BDSM.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
ovgsx
body_en:
Before you read the below, we'll just make this disclaimer:
Assault and rape fantasies are fantasies. And thus not an expression that you will experience it in reality.
Archive article
28-year-old Maiken from Jutland will not say that she is ashamed of her rape fantasy:
- But it's certainly not the first I've shared with people.
And the imagination that she uses now and then during masturbation is also a bit violent.
- Typically it is about a man breaking into my apartment while I am sleeping and forcing me to commit sexual excesses. More often than not, I am also 'drugged' by something during the act itself, so that I cannot resist.
- In my imagination, I don't notice so much that happens, but I am painfully aware that I have no choice, says Maiken, who is a webmaster on a daily basis.
Experiment
Maiken, who has a rich and varied sex life with many experiments on a daily basis - from anal sex to swinger sex - also says that she never puts a face to the man in her fantasy.
And she doesn't want to try it either - unlike many of her other fantasies.
- I couldn't think of living this out, as I don't really want to have so little control in reality. Which is strange, because at the same time I would say that it is an expression of an urge not to be in control - that I need someone else to make my choices for me and thus decide over me.
Science
Fantasizing about being forced into sex is widespread, especially among women, but also among men. You can call them rape fantasies, and they are basically about being taken against your will.
But what are they really about, and what are the characteristics of women who enjoy them?
American sex researcher Justin Lehmiller has taken a closer look at this. For his book 'Tell Me What You Want' he interviewed 4000 Americans about their sexual fantasies.
Here it appears that 61 percent of women have fantasized about forced sex, while one in four do it often.
54 percent of men have fantasized about being forced to have sex, while approximately one in ten do it often.
Would like
So regardless of gender, it seems that most people have had these abuse fantasies, with more women in particular having them more often. And people often describe them as 'something that deep down I would like to have.'
Which is quite logical, since you are in control of your imagination (but no one wants to live it out in the real world).
Psychologist Lehmiller offers suggestions on where the fantasies come from and what they mean. He also had the participants fill in questionnaires that show their personality traits. And so he found that there were certain interesting correlations between personality and frequent rape fantasies:
People who generally have a vivid imagination and reported many sexual fantasies were more likely to also fantasize about forced sex. It indicates that for some these fantasies are just an expression of having a vivid imagination. They tend to have a lot of variety in their fantasies because they have a vivid imagination. Not unlike Maiken, who comments on this.
People with a socio-sexual orientation (open to casual sex) have more fantasies about forced sex. These fantasies are therefore widespread among people who can distinguish between sex and emotions.
People with a so-called
sensation seeking
personality has more rape fantasies. This type of recreational person likes to look for new stimuli in and out of bed. Thus, forced sex fantasies seem to appeal to people who have an extra need for sexual kicks.
Individuals with many rape fantasies also had more BDSM fantasies in general, which may indicate that they are expressing a general interest in BDSM.
Assault
In addition, Justin Lehmiller observed some other correlations, which were not as pronounced as the ones mentioned above.
People with personal experiences of abuse also had more rape fantasies. According to Lehmiller, however, it was not a significant correlation, and many other studies have also pointed out that there is no connection.
Nevertheless, he dares to say that for some victims of abuse, forced sex fantasies can be a way to take control of past experiences where they had no control.
Furthermore, there was also a weak correlation between compulsive sex fantasies and people with low self-esteem and attachment problems in the form of excessive fear of abandonment. The small connection can be expressed like this: 'Finally there is someone who wants me so much that he forces me to do it.'
All in all, this means that rape fantasies mean something different from person to person - and so they are primarily an expression that the person probably has a lively imagination and needs many and varied sexual kicks and is probably fond of BDSM.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
ovgsx

title: Den ubehagelige sandhed om kyssebilledet
subtitle: Sømanden, der kysser kvinden på Times Square, er et ikoniske pletskud. Men historien bag det ellers så romantiske øjeblik er slet ikke, som alle troede
body:
default
Det helt rigtige øjeblik
fullwidth
black
Fotografiet med navnet 'V-J Day in Times Square' blev taget af den tyskfødte fotograf og fotojournalist Alfred Eisenstaedt 14. august 1945.
Forkortelsen i titlen dækker over 'Victory over Japan Day' (
sejr over Japan-dag, red.
), der var en spontan begivenhed, der fandt sted på Times Square i New York, da daværende præsident Harry S. Truman proklamerede USA's sejr over Japan.
Billedet blev bragt på forsiden af LIFE Magazine og på et opslag med overskriften 'Victory Celebrations', hvor læserne fik indblik i, hvordan de historiske fejringer, der markerede slutningen på Anden Verdenskrig, var løbet af stablen i byer som Washington D.C., Miami og ikke mindst New York.
Få sekunder
Eisenstaedt har fortalt, at han knipsede præcist fire billeder med sit Leica-kamera, og at det hele var overstået på et par sekunder.
'Jeg gik gennem menneskemængden på V-J Day i min søgen efter motiver. Jeg bemærkede en sømand, der kom imod mig. Han greb fat i alle kvinder, han kunne finde og kyssede dem - både unge og gamle damer', har Eisenstaedt fortalt i en af sine to bøger om sit liv og karriere.
Ifølge fotografen var det ikke mindst på grund af kontrasten mellem den mørke sømandsuniform og kvindes hvide kittel, at billedet blev så vellykket.
Husket for evigt
I bogen 'The Eye of Eisenstaedt', skriver han desuden, at han er klar over, at billedet er hans mest genkendelige og uden tvivl mest berømte.
'Folk fortæller mig, at når jeg er i himlen, vil de huske dette billede', lyder det i bogen.
Eisenstaedt døde i sommeren 1996. Han blev 96 år gammel. I sin imponerende karriere nåede han at få flere end 2.500 af sine billeder publiceret. 90 af dem prydede forsiderne på LIFE Magazine.
I alt nåede Eisenstaedt at tage mere end en million billeder i sin karriere, der begyndte i 1929 og først sluttede ved hans død.
default
Hvem var de?
fullwidth
black
En del af det ikoniske fotografis tiltrækningskraft er sandsynligvis, at det altid har været omgærdet af stor mystik, hvem de to kyssende personer på billedet egentlig er.
Den ellers topprofesionelle fotojournalist fik nemlig ikke noteret navnene, inden hovedpersonerne efter det flygtige møde forsvandt hvert til sit i den buldrende menneskemængde.
Og da man ikke på nogen af de fire billeder, han nåede at tage, tydeligt kan se ansigterne på hovedpersonerne, har det været noget nær umuligt at identificere dem efterfølgende.
Ingen henvendte sig
LIFE Magazine iværksatte umiddelbart efter publiceringen en undersøgelse for at finde frem til sømanden og kvinden, men ingen reagerede på deres henvendelse.
Mange år senere - i 1980 - modtog Eisenstaedt en henvendelse fra en kvinde, der ønskede en kopi og hævdede, at hun var kvinden på billedet.
Det fik LIFE Magazine til at genoptage detektivarbejdet, men de blev ikke meget klogere, da ganske mange forskellige mænd og kvinder henvendte sig, og hævdede, at det var dem, der var hovedpersonerne på det verdensberømte foto.
Bog om mysteriet
fullwidth
black
Mere end 30 år efter LIFE Magazines forgæves forsøg på at opklare mysteriet satte de to forfattere Lawrence Verria og George Galdorisi sig for at opklare sagen én gang for alle.
De gik særdeles grundigt til værks, og resultatet endte med i 2012 at blive udgivet som en bog med titlen 'The Kissing Sailor - The Mystery Behind the Photo That Ended World War II'.
Bogen indeholder interviews med flere af de personer, der hævder at være hovedpersonerne. Derudover har forfatterne brugt topmoderne ansigtsgenkendelses-teknologi og konsulteret en række eksperter i blandt andet ansigtsgenkendelse og fotoanalyse.
Greta & George
fullwidth
black
Selv om mange gennem årene har forsøgt at tage æren og berømmelsen som det kyssende par på Times Square, er det efterhånden almindeligt anerkendt, at det er Greta Zimmer Friedman og George Mendonsa, der er hovedpersonerne.
At det er er præcis de to, der kan verificeres som de 'ægte kyssende' skyldes i høj grad arbejdet med bogen 'The Kissing Sailor - The Mystery Behind the Photo That Ended World War II', der kom frem til den konklusion.
Ikke sygeplejerske
På billedet ovenfor ses de sammen til 4. juli-parade i 2009 i byen Bristol på Rhode Island, hvor de var inviteret som æresgæster og blev transporteret på en vogn, med en statue af dem i positur som på det berømte billede.
Greta Friedman, der for øvrigt ikke - som det ellers var bredt antaget - var sygeplejerske, men derimod klinikassistent hos en tandlæge, døde i 2016 i Richmond, Virginia af aldersrelaterede helbredsproblemer. Hun blev 92 år.
Beruset og opstemt
George Mendonsa blev efterfølgende gift med sin kæreste Rita, som han netop havde fundet sammen med, da han blev foreviget under V-J-festlighederne på Times Square.
Ifølge flere kilder var Rita med på gaden, da George - der har indrømmet at han var gevaldigt beruset - pludselig gik kysseamok.
Rita og George boede sammen i 70 år, indtil han døde i en plejebolig på Rhode Island 17. februar 2019. Han blev 95 år.
fullwidth
Edith & Carl
fullwidth
black
Udover Greta Zimmer Friedman og George Mendonsa - som der er bred enighed om er det ægte par - har flere end tolv forskellige mænd og en håndfuld kvinder forsøgt at stjæle rampelyset.
Det mest vedholdende par er Edith Shain og Carl Muscarello.
Ifølge undesøgelserne foretaget i forbindelse med bogen 'The Kissing Sailor - The Mystery Behind the Photo That Ended World War II' er Edith Shain dog så lav - 147 centimeter - at det med sikkerhed kan fastslås, at det ikke kan være hende, der optræder på billedet.
Identificeret af mor
Edith Shain henvendte sig i 1980 til fotograf Alfred Eisenstaedt med sin påstand om at være kvinden på billedet.
Carl Muscarello kom derimod relativt sent på banen med sin påstand om at være den kysseglade sømand.
Han henvendte sig først i 1995, efter hans mor ud fra et modermærke på hans hånd mente, at det måtte være hendes søn på billedet.
Carl og Edith blev efterfølgende kortvarigt kærester og turnerede vidt og bredt med deres historie. I 2005 var Edith dog knap så sikker som tidligere på, at deres historie holdt vand.
Stærkt beruset
'Jeg kan ikke sige, at det ikke er ham. Jeg kan heller ikke sige, at det er. Der er simpelthen ingen mulighed for at vide det', sagde hun til avisen.
Carl Muscarello har fortalt, at han den pågældende dag, hvor fotografiet blev taget, var voldsomt beruset og derfor næsten intet husker.
Han fortæller desuden, at det var hans mor, der gjorde ham opmærksom på, at det måtte være ham på fotoet, og at han derefter selv begyndte at tro på det.
Var det et overgreb?
fullwidth
black
Man skal som bekendt passe på med at dømme fortiden efter nutidens standarder.
For de fleste repræsenterer billedet ganske uskyldigt glæden og euforien blandt amerikanerne, der brød løs ved afslutningen af Anden Verdenskrig.
Med til historien hører dog det ganske centrale, at den kvindelige hovedperson - Greta Zimmer Friedman - i utvetydige vendinger gentagne gange har fortalt, at hun på ingen måde havde bedt om eller havde lyst til at blive overmandet og holdt fast og kysset af en mand, hun absolut intet forhold havde til.
'Det var ikke mit valg at blive kysset. Fyren kom bare og tog fat i mig!, sagde Greta Zimmer Friedman i et interview i 2005 med Library of Congress og tilføjede:
'Den mand var meget stærk. Jeg kyssede ikke ham. Det var ham, der kyssede mig'.
I 2012 sagde hun i et interview med CBS, at hun blev holdt hårdt fast.
'Jeg så ikke, at han nærmede sig, og før jeg vidste af det, blev jeg holdt stramt fast af ham'.
På flere af de i alt fire billeder, Alfred Eisenstaedt tog af situationen kan man ifølge historiker Kafi Benz se, at Greta forsøger at forsvare sig og kæmpe sig fri af grebet - blandt andet ved at slå ud efter sømanden med den ene hånd, hun har fri.
Ifølge kritikere er billedet udtryk for hvordan denne type krænkelser var bredt accepteret i datidens mandsdominerede samfund.
Greta har aldrig efterfølgende været villig til at stille op til genskabelse af det ikoniske foto.
Med i The Simpsons
black
black
Kysset på Times Square er gennem årene blevet så indgroet en del af populærkulturen, at det er blevet genskabt og brugt i både tegnefilm, computerspil, spillefilm og kunstværker.
Den mest berømte genanvendelse er sandsynligvis den i et afsnit af den tegnede tv-komedie 'The Simpsons', hvor Bart Simpsons altid handlekraftige søster, Lisa, tildeler en gedigen lussing til en dreng, der som sømanden på Times Square forsøger sig med et kys.
body_en:
default
The perfect moment
fullwidth
black
The photograph named 'V-J Day in Times Square' was taken by German-born photographer and photojournalist Alfred Eisenstaedt on August 14, 1945.
The abbreviation in the title covers 'Victory over Japan Day' (
Victory over Japan Day, ed.
), was a spontaneous event that took place in Times Square in New York when then-President Harry S. Truman proclaimed the victory of the United States over Japan.
The photo was featured on the cover of LIFE Magazine and in a spread titled 'Victory Celebrations', where readers were given an insight into how the historic celebrations marking the end of World War II had gone awry in cities such as Washington D.C., Miami and not at least New York.
Few seconds
Eisenstaedt has said that he snapped exactly four pictures with his Leica camera and that it was all over in a few seconds.
'I walked through the crowd on V-J Day in my search for motifs. I noticed a sailor coming towards me. He grabbed every woman he could find and kissed them - both young and old ladies', Eisenstaedt has told in one of his two books about his life and career.
According to the photographer, it was not least because of the contrast between the dark sailor's uniform and the woman's white smock that the image was so successful.
Remembered forever
In the book 'The Eye of Eisenstaedt', he also writes that he is aware that the picture is his most recognizable and undoubtedly his most famous.
'People tell me that when I'm in heaven they'll remember this picture,' the book reads.
Eisenstaedt died in the summer of 1996. He was 96 years old. In his impressive career, he managed to get more than 2,500 of his pictures published. 90 of them graced the covers of LIFE Magazine.
In total, Eisenstaedt managed to take more than a million pictures in his career, which began in 1929 and did not end until his death.
default
Who were they?
fullwidth
black
Part of the appeal of the iconic photograph is probably that it has always been shrouded in great mystery as to who the two kissing people in the picture really are.
The otherwise top professional photojournalist didn't note the names before the main characters disappeared into the roaring crowd after the fleeting meeting.
And since you can't clearly see the faces of the main characters in any of the four photos he managed to take, it has been almost impossible to identify them afterwards.
No one approached
LIFE Magazine launched an investigation immediately after publication to find the sailor and the woman, but no one responded to their inquiry.
Many years later - in 1980 - Eisenstaedt received an inquiry from a woman who wanted a copy and claimed to be the woman in the picture.
That prompted LIFE Magazine to resume detective work, but they didn't get much wiser when quite a few different men and women approached, claiming they were the main characters in the world-famous photo.
Book about the mystery
fullwidth
black
More than 30 years after LIFE Magazine's unsuccessful attempt to solve the mystery, the two authors Lawrence Verria and George Galdorisi set out to solve the case once and for all.
They went to work very thoroughly, and the result ended up being published in 2012 as a book with the title 'The Kissing Sailor - The Mystery Behind the Photo That Ended World War II'.
The book contains interviews with several of the people who claim to be the main characters. In addition, the authors have used state-of-the-art facial recognition technology and consulted a number of experts in, among other things, facial recognition and photo analysis.
Greta & George
fullwidth
black
Although many have tried over the years to take credit and fame as the kissing couple in Times Square, it is now generally accepted that Greta Zimmer Friedman and George Mendonsa are the main characters.
That it is exactly the two who can be verified as the 'real kissers' is largely due to the work with the book 'The Kissing Sailor - The Mystery Behind the Photo That Ended World War II', which came to that conclusion.
Not a nurse
In the photo above, they are seen together at the 4th of July parade in 2009 in the city of Bristol, Rhode Island, where they were invited as guests of honor and were transported on a carriage, with a statue of them in the pose as in the famous photo.
Greta Friedman, who by the way was not - as was widely assumed - a nurse, but rather a clinic assistant at a dentist, died in 2016 in Richmond, Virginia of age-related health problems. She lived to be 92 years old.
Drunk and elated
George Mendonsa subsequently married his girlfriend Rita, whom he had just met when he was immortalized during the V-J celebrations in Times Square.
According to several sources, Rita was on the street when George - who has admitted that he was extremely drunk - suddenly went on a kissing spree.
Rita and George lived together for 70 years until he died in a nursing home in Rhode Island on February 17, 2019. He was 95 years old.
fullwidth
Edith & Carl
fullwidth
black
Besides Greta Zimmer Friedman and George Mendonsa - who are widely agreed to be the real couple - more than a dozen different men and a handful of women have tried to steal the limelight.
The most persistent couple is Edith Shain and Carl Muscarello.
According to the investigations carried out in connection with the book 'The Kissing Sailor - The Mystery Behind the Photo That Ended World War II', however, Edith Shain is so short - 147 centimeters - that it can be determined with certainty that it cannot be her who appears on the picture.
Identified by mother
Edith Shain approached photographer Alfred Eisenstaedt in 1980 with her claim to be the woman in the picture.
Carl Muscarello, on the other hand, came relatively late on the scene with his claim to be the kissable sailor.
He only approached in 1995, after his mother, based on a birthmark on his hand, thought it must be her son in the picture.
Carl and Edith subsequently briefly became lovers and toured far and wide with their story. In 2005, however, Edith was less sure than before that their story held water.
Heavily drunk
'I can't say it's not him. I can't say it is either. There is simply no way of knowing,' she told the newspaper.
Carl Muscarello has said that on the day in question, when the photograph was taken, he was violently drunk and therefore remembers almost nothing.
He also says that it was his mother who alerted him that it must be him in the photo, and that he then began to believe it himself.
Was it an assault?
fullwidth
black
As you know, you have to be careful about judging the past by today's standards.
For most, the image quite innocently represents the joy and euphoria among Americans who broke loose at the end of World War II.
The central part of the story, however, is that the female protagonist - Greta Zimmer Friedman - has repeatedly told in unequivocal terms that she had in no way asked or wanted to be overpowered and held and kissed by a man, she had absolutely no relationship with.
'It was not my choice to be kissed. The guy just came and grabbed me!, said Greta Zimmer Friedman in a 2005 interview with the Library of Congress, adding:
'That man was very strong. I didn't kiss him. He was the one who kissed me'.
In 2012, she said in an interview with CBS that she was held tightly.
'I didn't see him approach and before I knew it I was held tightly by him'.
In several of the total of four photos that Alfred Eisenstaedt took of the situation, according to historian Kafi Benz, you can see that Greta tries to defend herself and fight free from the grip - among other things by striking out at the sailor with the one hand she has free.
According to critics, the picture is an expression of how this type of violation was widely accepted in the male-dominated society of the time.
Greta has never subsequently been willing to stand up for the recreation of the iconic photo.
Featured in The Simpsons
black
black
Over the years, the kiss in Times Square has become such an ingrained part of popular culture that it has been recreated and used in both cartoons, computer games, feature films and works of art.
The most famous reuse is probably the one in an episode of the animated television comedy 'The Simpsons', where Bart Simpson's always energetic sister, Lisa, gives a hearty slap to a boy who, like the sailor in Times Square, attempts a kiss.

title: Udvist: Rockere i voldsom afpresningssag
subtitle: Ville afkræve udsmidt Satudarah-rocker 700.000 kr og overfaldt manden med en kulskovl
body:
Seks mænd er nu blevet dømt i forbindelse med en sag om vold og afpresning. Tre af mændene har direkte tilknytning til rockerklubben Satudarah, og offeret i sagen var selv tidligere medlem af Satudarah.
Det kom frem under retssagen, der kørte ved Retten i Nykøbing Falster. Dommen i sagen blev afsagt torsdag i sidste uge.
Her nægtede alle seks sig skyldige i sagens hovedpunkter, og kun en af de seks erkendte sit medlemsskab af rockerklubben. Men det er politiet vurdering, at yderligere to af de tiltalte er part af rockerklubbens struktur. Den ene er i følge politiets opfattelse del af Satudarah-støtteklubben Navajo MC.
Mand i alarmopkald:- Det er Satudarah, der er efter mig
To af de tiltalte fik hver et år og tre måneders fængsel, mens en tredje fik et års fængsel i sagen. En af de tiltalte - Zohair Nasser - blev desuden idømt udvisning i 12 år. I øvrigt ikke hans første, da han i forvejen er udvist og opholder sig på såkaldt tålt ophold.
Opholdsforbud i klubhuse
I forbindelse med sagen blev de ligeledes idømt opholdsforbud i rockerklubbens klubhuse, der gælder tre år.
De sidste tre tiltalte fik hver mellem fire og fem måneders fængsel i sagen.
Afpresningsaffæren udspillede sig 22. juni fjor, og i da han vidnede i retssagen, forklarede offeret, hvordan han den pågældende dag var blevet beordret til at møde op ved en Meny i Bagsværd.
Her blev han mødt af tre af sagens tiltalte, der tvang ham ud til et skovområde i udkanten af Bagsværd.
Kniv for struben
- Der får jeg en kniv for struben. Jeg får at vide, at jeg skal betale 700.000 kr og at jeg var i BS - Bad Standing, forklarede offeret.
Efterfølgende blev han sendt af sted og fik besked på at skaffe 125.000 kr, der skulle betales senere samme dag.
Senere samme aften blev han opsøgt i sit hjem på Møn. Her blev blev manden, forklarede han i retten, overfaldet og blandt andet slået med en kulskovl og fik væltet en reol ned over sig, forklarede han i retten. På et tidspunkt så han sit snit til at stikke af ud gennem et vindue.
Sag om rockervold: 'Når han er på stoffer, siger han ting, der ikke passer'
Derefter flygtede han ud på en mark, hvor han forsøgte at gemme sig.
Han havde fået sin telefon med sig, og ringede til alarmcentralen:
- 'Det er 'Satudarah, der er efter mig. Det er Satudarah', lød det blandt andet i opkaldene til alarmcemtralen.
Sagens seks tiltalte udbad sig betænkningstid i forhold til at anke dommen til landsretten.
Zohair Nasser
body_en:
Six men have now been sentenced in connection with a case of violence and extortion. Three of the men are directly connected to the rock club Satudarah, and the victim in the case was himself a former member of Satudarah.
It came to light during the trial, which ran at the Court in Nykøbing Falster. The verdict in the case was handed down on Thursday last week.
Here, all six pleaded not guilty to the main points of the case, and only one of the six admitted his membership of the rock club. But it is the police's assessment that two more of the defendants are part of the rock club's structure. According to the police, one is part of the Satudarah support club Navajo MC.
Man in emergency call:- It is Satudarah who is after me
Two of the defendants each received one year and three months in prison, while a third received one year in prison in the case. One of the defendants - Zohair Nasser - was also sentenced to deportation for 12 years. Incidentally, not his first, as he has already been deported and is staying on a so-called tolerated stay.
Prohibition of staying in clubhouses
In connection with the case, they were also sentenced to a stay ban in the rock club's clubhouses, valid for three years.
The last three defendants each received between four and five months in prison in the case.
The extortion affair took place on 22 June last year, and when he testified in the trial, the victim explained how he had been ordered to appear at a Meny in Bagsværd on the day in question.
Here he was met by three of the defendants in the case, who forced him out to a forest area on the outskirts of Bagsværd.
Knife for the throat
- I'll get a knife to my throat there. I am told that I have to pay DKK 700,000 and that I was in BS - Bad Standing, explained the victim.
Subsequently, he was sent away and told to get DKK 125,000, which had to be paid later that day.
Later that evening, he was approached at his home on Møn. Here the man, he explained in court, was assaulted and, among other things, beaten with a coal shovel and had a bookcase knocked over him, he explained in court. At one point, he saw his cut to run away through a window.
Case of rocker violence: 'When he's on drugs, he says things that don't fit'
He then fled into a field where he tried to hide.
He had brought his phone with him, and called the emergency center:
- 'It is 'Satudarah who is after me. It's Satudarah', it sounded, among other things, in the calls to the emergency center.
The six defendants in the case asked for time to think about whether to appeal the verdict to the High Court.
Zohair Nasser

title: Drama og diamanter: Det vidste du ikke om Pitzner-familien
subtitle: Et luksuriøst liv på første klasse med diamanter om halsen og hummer på menuen. Det er sådan, vi er vant til at se familien Pitzner i reality-serien 'Diamantfamilien'. Men familiens liv er langtfra kun skinnende idyl
body:
Arvestrid, overfald, kræft og et forsvindingsnummer. Ikke alt er så skinnende glamourøst, som det ser ud til i den kendte diamant-familie.
Kom tættere på Pitzner-klanen her.
-------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Bitter arvestrid
Seks sæsoner af føljetonen om Elvira, Thalia, Lille O. og mor Katerina har indtil videre rullet over skærmen på TV 2. Men når man sidder og lapper deres rapkæftede luksusliv i sig, skal man huske på, at tv kun viser en del af virkeligheden. Familiens liv har nemlig budt på mange dramatiske op- og nedture.
Katerina Pitzner er datter af den afdøde millionær Axel Pitzner. Han byggede sin formue op blandt andet ved at udleje biler. Faren drak, og hans kendte datter har selv fortalt, at han i en af sine branderter jagtede og truede familien med et gevær, da hun var barn. Men han gjorde også en dyd ud af at sikre sin familie økonomisk.
Da Katerina Pitzner var 17 år, viste hendes far hende en diamant til en værdi af fem millioner kroner. Den havde han købt som en familieforsikring, hvis hans forretninger skulle gå skævt.
Det blev aldrig nødvendigt at bruge den forsikring. Axel Pitzner var god for et trecifret millionbeløb, da han i 2005 døde på sin særdeles luksuriøse lystejendom, Solhøjgaard.
Axel Pitzner efterlod sig seks børn, og han blev efter tre års separation skilt fra sin sidste kone bare tre uger inden sin død. På hans dødsleje blev de dog gift igen, og det blev startskuddet på en langvarig og bitter arvestrid.
Katerina Pitzner og hendes søskende var - og er formentlig stadig - overbeviste om, at ægteskabet med Carina er et falsum, og at underskriften på vielsesattesten er forfalsket.
- Hvorfor skulle han gøre det? Han havde været separeret fra denne kvinde i tre år og boede sammen med en anden kvinde. Det hang ikke sammen, har Katerina Pitzner tidligere sagt til
B.T
. om ægteskabet på faderens dødsleje.
Sagen om ægteskabet havnede i 2008 i retten. Her blev det kendt gyldigt til stor overraskelse for Katerina Pitzner og hendes søskende.
Katerina eller Carina
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Kongelig ridelærer overfaldet med hammer
Det er ikke kun Katerinas egen far, der har en særdeles interessant historie. Det har faderen til hendes to ældste børn, Thalia og Elvira, også.
Hans Helmgaard Kristiansen hedder Thalia og Elviras far. Ud over at være forretningsmand har han kunnet kalde sig kongelig ridelærer.
Det var Hans Helmgaard Kristiansen, der lærte kronprinsesse Mary at ride, da hun kom til Danmark, og det var på mange måder et kontroversielt valg.
I 1990’erne blev han idømt i alt fem års karantæne af Dansk Idrætsforbund, da han nægtede udtale sig i en sag om hestes ID-papirer.
I 2003 indrømmede Helmgaard Kristiansen at have skærpet hestenes opmærksomhed ved berøring af benene med en bambuskæp for at få dem til at springe højere. Metoden kaldes 'touchering'. Det er Hans Helmgaard Kristiansen dog ikke drømt for.
Tilbage i 2013 blev Hans Helmgaard Kristiansen på vej hjem fra en rideskole i Vipperød udsat for et voldsomt overfald, hvor han blev slået med en hammer og blev stukket i halsen med en foldekniv.
Overfaldet resulterede i to brud på kæben, et trykket brystben og et brækket håndled, og den blev at politiet behandlet som et mordforsøg.
Elvira forsvandt
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Kæreste med Grand Prix-stjerne og Alexandras eks
Katerina Pitzner har i alt fire børn med to forskellige mænd. Mens Hans Helmgaard Kristiansen er far til de to ældste, har hun Ophelia og Hector med sin svenske eksmand.
Derudover har hun haft flere kendte kærester.
Tilbage i midten af 90'erne dannede nu 49-årige Pitzner par med den 11 år ældre Grand Prix-stjerne Anders Frandsen.
Trods det kærlighedsmæssige brud bevarede parret kontakten frem til
Anders Frandsens pludselig død 1. januar 2012.
Katerina Pitzner har også offentlig kysset med Toni Lindkold, som tidligere dannede par med grevinde Alexandra.
Forholdet til Alex sluttede prompte, da det kom frem, at den tidligere politimand og PET-agent havde en kriminel fortid og var dømt for ophavsretskrænkelse ved at have solgt kopimøbler.
Katerina - kræft
body_en:
Inheritance dispute, assault, cancer and a disappearance number. Not everything is as shiny and glamorous as it seems in the famous diamond family.
Get closer to the Pitzner clan here.
-------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Bitter inheritance dispute
Six seasons of the series about Elvira, Thalia, Lille O. and mother Katerina have so far rolled across the screen on TV 2. But when you sit and lap up their rapturous luxury life, you have to remember that TV only shows a part of reality . The family's life has offered many dramatic ups and downs.
Katerina Pitzner is the daughter of the late millionaire Axel Pitzner. He built up his fortune, among other things, by renting out cars. The father drank, and his well-known daughter herself has said that he chased and threatened the family with a gun in one of his firefights when she was a child. But he also made a virtue of securing his family financially.
When Katerina Pitzner was 17, her father showed her a diamond worth five million kroner. He had bought it as family insurance in case his business went awry.
It was never necessary to use that insurance. Axel Pitzner was good for a three-figure million sum when he died in 2005 at his extremely luxurious luxury property, Solhøjgaard.
Axel Pitzner left behind six children, and after three years of separation he was divorced from his last wife just three weeks before his death. On his deathbed, however, they remarried, and that was the start of a long and bitter succession dispute.
Katerina Pitzner and her siblings were - and probably still are - convinced that the marriage with Carina is a forgery and that the signature on the marriage certificate is forged.
- Why would he do that? He had been separated from this woman for three years and was living with another woman. It was not connected, Katerina Pitzner has previously said
B.T
. about the marriage on the father's deathbed.
The case about the marriage ended up in court in 2008. Here it became known valid, to the great surprise of Katerina Pitzner and her siblings.
Katerina or Carina
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Royal riding instructor assaulted with hammer
It is not only Katerina's own father who has a particularly interesting story. So has the father of her two eldest children, Thalia and Elvira.
Hans Helmgaard Kristiansen is Thalia and Elvira's father. In addition to being a businessman, he has been able to call himself a royal riding instructor.
It was Hans Helmgaard Kristiansen who taught Crown Princess Mary to ride when she came to Denmark, and it was in many ways a controversial choice.
In the 1990s, he was sentenced to a total of five years' quarantine by the Danish Sports Confederation when he refused to speak out in a case about horses' ID papers.
In 2003, Helmgaard Kristiansen admitted to having sharpened the horses' attention by touching their legs with a bamboo stick to make them jump higher. The method is called 'touching'. However, Hans Helmgaard Kristiansen did not dream of that.
Back in 2013, Hans Helmgaard Kristiansen was subjected to a violent attack on his way home from a riding school in Vipperød, where he was beaten with a hammer and stabbed in the throat with a folding knife.
The assault resulted in two broken jaws, a crushed sternum and a broken wrist, and was treated by the police as attempted murder.
Elvira disappeared
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Boyfriend with Grand Prix star and Alexandra's ex
Katerina Pitzner has a total of four children with two different men. While Hans Helmgaard Kristiansen is the father of the two eldest, she has Ophelia and Hector with her Swedish ex-husband.
In addition, she has had several well-known boyfriends.
Back in the mid-90s, the now 49-year-old Pitzner paired up with Grand Prix star Anders Frandsen, who was 11 years older.
Despite the love breakup, the couple maintained contact until
Anders Frandsen's sudden death on 1 January 2012.
Katerina Pitzner has also publicly kissed Toni Lindkold, who previously formed a couple with Countess Alexandra.
The relationship with Alex promptly ended when it emerged that the former policeman and PET agent had a criminal past and had been convicted of copyright infringement by selling copy furniture.
Katerina - cancer

title: Hjemsted for de rige og berømte: Kom indenfor
subtitle: Hotellet The Waldorf Astoria i New York har i årtier været et knudepunkt for royale, statsledere, filmstjerner og musikere. Og nu kan du også købe en lille lejlighed på det mytiske hotel
body:
Ekstravagant. Glamourøst. Luksuriøst. Majestætisk.
Det kræver et pompøst ordvalg at skulle beskrive, hvor prægtigt det sagnomspundne hotel Waldorf Astoria i New York City, USA, har ry for at være.
Det skyldes blandt andet, at det ikoniske hotel, der er kendt som New Yorks uofficielle palads, har dannet ramme om nogle af de mest eksklusive begivenheder i nyere tid.
Og så skyldes det i særdeleshed det storslåede galleri af celebre skikkelser, for hvem hotellet har været det absolut foretrukne, når de har besøgt 'The Big Apple'.
Faktisk har flere kendisser i perioder boet mere eller mindre permanent på Waldorf Astoria, og blandt andre Frank Sinatra og Marilyn Monroe har i offentligheden kaldt hotellet for deres andet hjem.
fullwidth
Netop nu har hotellet givet mulighed for, at man kan få ejerskab i et af dets storslåede værelser.
Det sker i forbindelse med, at Waldorf Astoria i oktober 2021 fejrer 90-års jubilæum.
Fra 2023 slår hotellet dørene op for nyistandsatte faciliteter efter at have været lukket i mere end fire år.
Den massive renovation har kostet omkring en milliard dollars - svarende til knap 6,5 milliarder danske kroner.
fullwidth
Til gengæld vil der også være etableret 375 nye ejerlejligheder.
Lejlighederne kan købes fra omkring 11 millioner danske kroner for en etværelses til 119 millioner danske kroner for en fireværelses.
Læg dertil, at der vil være to penthouse-suiter, hvis prislejet foreløbigt er hemmeligholdt.
fullwidth
Beboere vil blandt andet have den såkaldte Starlight Pool, der måler knap 25 meter, til rådighed.
Det rum, hvor poolen befinder sig i, gik tidligere under navnet Starlight Roof. Her har kunstnere som Frank Sinatra og jazzsangerinden Ella Fitzgerald optrådt.
Det åbnede under Den Store Depression, den omfattende økonomisk verdenskrise forårsaget af krakket på Wall Street i 1929.
Ikke desto mindre var luksus-segmentet i New York alligevel rede på at lade sig indlogere på det nye hotel.
Historien om Waldorf-hotellet trækker dog tråde længere tilbage i historien. Det originale hotel blev nemlig opført på Fifth Avenue i 1893 af William Waldorf Astor.
Fire år senere opførte John Jacob Astor IV, William Waldorf Astors fætter og ærkerival, et endnu højere hotel lige ved siden af.
Efter noget tid besluttede de to fætre sig at indgå våbenhvile og slå pjalterne sammen.
Således blev de to hoteller forenet i ét gennem knap 100 meters korridor lavet af marmor, som i dag er kendt som Peacock Alley - 'Påfugle-gyden'.
Hermed blev Waldorf Astoria født.
fullwidth
fullwidth
default
Dertil har også danskere besøgt Waldorf Astoria, herunder Dronning Ingrid og Anders Fogh Rasmussen.
Listen af kendte navne er både fascinerende og lang, hvoraf størstedelen af hotellets gæster i hovedtræk er ekstremt rige og berømte.
Ikke alene har gæsterne overnattet på hotellet. De har også arrangeret politiske konferencer, velgørenhedsarrangementer, gallaevents, koncerter og privatarrangementer.
Hotellet gemmer derfor også på sladder og fakta om store beslutninger, saftige affærer og frigjorte festligheder.
body_en:
Extravagant. Glamorous. Luxurious. Majestic.
It requires a pompous choice of words to describe how magnificent the fabled Waldorf Astoria hotel in New York City, USA, has a reputation for being.
This is partly because the iconic hotel, which is known as New York's unofficial palace, has been the setting for some of the most exclusive events in recent times.
And then it is due in particular to the magnificent gallery of famous figures, for whom the hotel has been the absolute favorite when they have visited 'The Big Apple'.
In fact, several celebrities have lived more or less permanently at the Waldorf Astoria for periods of time, and among others Frank Sinatra and Marilyn Monroe have publicly called the hotel their second home.
fullwidth
Just now, the hotel has made it possible for you to take ownership of one of its magnificent rooms.
It is happening in connection with the Waldorf Astoria celebrating its 90th anniversary in October 2021.
From 2023, the hotel opens its doors to newly renovated facilities after being closed for more than four years.
The massive renovation has cost around one billion dollars - equivalent to just under 6.5 billion Danish kroner.
fullwidth
In return, 375 new owner-occupied apartments will also be established.
The apartments can be bought from around 11 million Danish kroner for a one-bedroom to 119 million Danish kroner for a four-bedroom.
Add to that that there will be two penthouse suites, the price of which is kept secret for the time being.
fullwidth
Residents will, among other things, have the so-called Starlight Pool, which measures just under 25 metres, at their disposal.
The space in which the pool is located was formerly known as the Starlight Roof. Artists such as Frank Sinatra and the jazz singer Ella Fitzgerald have performed here.
It opened during the Great Depression, the widespread world financial crisis caused by the Wall Street Crash of 1929.
Nevertheless, the luxury segment in New York was still ready to stay at the new hotel.
The story of the Waldorf hotel, however, draws threads further back in history. The original hotel was built on Fifth Avenue in 1893 by William Waldorf Astor.
Four years later, John Jacob Astor IV, William Waldorf Astor's cousin and arch-rival, built an even taller hotel next door.
After some time the two cousins ​​decided to make a truce and join forces.
Thus, the two hotels were united in one through a nearly 100-metre corridor made of marble, which today is known as Peacock Alley - 'Påfugle-gyden'.
With this, the Waldorf Astoria was born.
fullwidth
fullwidth
default
In addition, Danes have also visited the Waldorf Astoria, including Queen Ingrid and Anders Fogh Rasmussen.
The list of famous names is both fascinating and long, with the majority of the hotel's guests being extremely rich and famous.
Not only did the guests spend the night at the hotel. They have also organized political conferences, charity events, gala events, concerts and private events.
The hotel therefore also stores gossip and facts about big decisions, juicy affairs and liberated celebrations.
ner_clusters:
['Anders Fogh Rasmussen' 'danskere' 'Den Store Depression'
 'Dronning Ingrid' 'Ella Fitzgerald' 'Fifth Avenue' 'Frank Sinatra'
 'John Jacob Astor IV' 'Marilyn Monroe' 'New York City' 'Påfugle'
 'Peacock Alley' 'Starlight Pool' 'The Big Apple' 'USA' 'Waldorf Astoria'
 'Waldorf Astoria' 'Wall Street' 'William Waldorf Astors']

title: Aktier: Disse fejl koster nybegyndere dyrt
subtitle: Hopper du ind og ud af markedet ti gange på et år, kan det have enorm effekt på dine investeringer, viser tal fra C25-indekset. Derfor er din adfærd utrolig vigtig - og gode investeringer er oftest røvkedelige
body:
Nye aktionærers overmodige adfærd på aktiemarkedet kan koste dem dyre lærepenge. Her giver investeringschef og ekspert i adfærdsdesign deres bedste bud på, hvordan du undgår en uheldig debut på aktiemarkedet
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Du kan ikke slå markedet!
Det er blevet bevist gang på gang - og det gælder i øvrigt både private investorer, professionelle og supercomputere. Alligevel er det netop troen på, at man kan forudse, hvilke aktier der vil gå op og ned, der får nye investorer til at kaste sig hovedkulds ud i aktiemarkedet - ofte med tab til følge.
Det forklarer Morten Münster, som er ekspert i adfærdsdesign og forfatteren bag bøgerne om 'Jytte fra Marketing'.
Overdrevet selvtillid
Han peger på to problematikker, der spiller ind.
- Det handler først og fremmest om overdreven selvtillid. Rigtig mange tror, de kan regne markedet ud, fordi de har læst noget i Børsen eller har hørt noget fra en ven - men det kan de ikke, siger han og uddyber:
- Det er en bias, der ikke kun gælder på aktiemarkedet. Det er samme mekanisme, når det kommer til slankekure, hvor mange tænker: 'Lige nu kan jeg ikke overholde en slankekur, men om en måned er jeg et andet menneske'. Mennesker er generelt overmodige - og især i forhold til forudsigelser om fremtiden.
Og det er det samme, der gælder, når mennesker laver virksomhedsstrategier. For selvom året er gået helt urimeligt dårligt, tænker vi helt naivt, at der ingen grænser er for, hvor godt næste år kan blive, nævner Morten Münster som eksempel.
Vi tror på det, vi hører
Den anden problematik er en anekdotisk bias. Det dækker over, at vi som mennesker har det med at overvurdere historiers værdi.
- Hvis naboen fortæller om sin nye Skoda, som er gået i stykker, og tilføjer, hvor frustrerende det er med ventetiden hos mekanikeren, vil man aldrig selv købe den Skoda - selvom alle bilmærker jo går i stykker, siger Morten Münster.
Det samme gør sig gældende for historier, du læser i medierne. Mange tror eksempelvis, der begås langt flere drab end selvmord i Danmark, fordi førstnævnte får massiv mediedækning, mens sidstnævnte sjældent nævnes. Men det er langt fra sandheden.
- Og hvis man først har hørt en historie om en ven, som har haft held med investering i kryptovaluta, vil den også betyde langt mere for en end et kig i statistikkerne, fortsætter adfærdseksperten.
Men det ender sjældent med, at du selv scorer samme gevinst. For det er held eller tilfældigheder, der spiller ind. Du kan ikke slå markedet, slår han endnu en gang fast.
- Jeg vil anbefale, at man stiller sig selv spørgsmålet: Hvad er det, der gør, at jeg tror, at
jeg
ved noget om Amazon - eller en anden virksomhed - som mennesker, der arbejder med aktier 150 timer om ugen
ikke
ved? Selv de professionelle kan jo ikke slå markedet, siger han.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Ti gode dage har enorm effekt
Det kan hurtigt blive en dyr fornøjelse for nye investorer, der tror, de kan ramme jackpot på aktiemarkedet. For når markedet pludselig ikke gør, som man havde forventet, er der rigtig mange, der hopper ind og ud på uhensigtsmæssige tidspunkter.
For eksempel vælger mange uerfarne investorer at sælge, når aktiekurserne falder - for at begrænse tabet. Men det skal man ikke gøre. I stedet skal man holde ud gennem nedturen, fastslår Anders Hartmann, der er CEO i Nord Investments.
- Det er en skidt tendens, som ofte ender ud i, at folk mister både hele og halve formuer, siger han.
10 dage, 20 procentpoint
Ser man eksempelvis på, hvordan C25-indekset, som dækker over de 25 største virksomheder i Danmark, opførte sig i 2021, er det et godt eksempel på, hvorfor det kan blive en dyr fornøjelse at gå ind og ud af markedet.
For de store udsving, der kan være på enkelte dage, kan have kæmpestor betydning.
Var man således på markedet i hele perioden - fra 1. januar til 6. december 2021, hvor tallene er trukket - ville man lande på et afkast på 10,49 procent.
Men var man ude af markedet på de 10 bedste dage, ville man i stedet lande på et negativt afkast på -10,86 procent.
- Det er selvfølgelig et teoretisk eksempel bygget på, at man går ind og ud af markedet hele året og tilfældigvis ikke er der på de 10 bedste dage, men det viser alligevel meget godt, hvor vigtigt det er at forblive i markedet og ikke sælge, når det i perioder går dårligt, siger Anders Hartmann.
Han tilføjer, at det globale aktiemarked viser samme tendens, hvis man ser tilbage over en tiårig periode.
Invester hver måned
Så drop kampen mod markedet, og lad i stedet dine investeringer styre af, hvornår du har penge til rådighed, som du ikke skal bruge inden for en årrække.
For som en gammel slager inden for investeringsbranchen lyder: 'Tid på markedet slår timing på markedet' - eller med andre ord: Du kan ikke time dine investeringer, men tiden vil til gengæld oftest arbejde for dig.
Set i et historisk perspektiv har det nemlig været en god forretning - men det kræver altså, at man har tid til at vente og ikke skal bruge pengene om et år.
- Vi plejer at sige, at man skal have en tidshorisont på mindst tre år. Ellers bliver det simpelthen for usikkert, siger Anders Hartmann.
FAKTA - risikoprofil
God investering er røvkedeligt
Og når du skal vælge dine investeringer, så gå efter indeksfonde og ikke enkeltaktier, råder både Anders Hartmann og Morten Münster. For selvom det ikke nødvendigvis er lige så spændende at følge med i, er det den sikreste vej til gevinst.
- God investering er bare røvkedeligt, siger Morten Münster.
Samtidig råder han til, at man holder sig til passive fonde, hvor det er en computer, der foretager investeringerne - frem for en aktiv, hvor der sidder mennesker og udvælger aktier.
Sidstnævnte koster nemlig typisk væsentlig mere, men resultatet står sjældent mål med regningen.
body_en:
The presumptuous behavior of new shareholders in the stock market can cost them expensive lessons. Here, an investment manager and an expert in behavioral design give their best advice on how to avoid an unfortunate debut on the stock market
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
You can't beat the market!
It has been proven time and time again - and this also applies to private investors, professionals and supercomputers alike. Yet it is precisely the belief that you can predict which stocks will go up and down that makes new investors plunge headlong into the stock market - often with losses as a result.
This is explained by Morten Münster, who is an expert in behavioral design and the author behind the books on 'Jytte from Marketing'.
Excessive confidence
He points to two issues that come into play.
- It is primarily about excessive self-confidence. A lot of people think they can calculate the market because they have read something in the Stock Exchange or have heard something from a friend - but they can't, he says and elaborates:
- It is a bias that does not only apply to the stock market. It's the same mechanism when it comes to dieting, where many people think: 'Right now I can't stick to a diet, but in a month I'll be a different person'. People are generally overconfident - and especially in relation to predictions about the future.
And the same is true when people make business strategies. Because even though the year has gone completely unreasonably badly, we naively think that there are no limits to how good next year can be, Morten Münster cites as an example.
We believe what we hear
The second problem is an anecdotal bias. It covers the fact that we as humans tend to overestimate the value of stories.
- If the neighbor talks about his new Skoda, which has broken down, and adds how frustrating it is with the waiting time at the mechanic, you will never buy that Skoda yourself - even though all car brands break down, says Morten Münster.
The same applies to stories you read in the media. Many believe, for example, that far more murders than suicides are committed in Denmark, because the former gets massive media coverage, while the latter is rarely mentioned. But that is far from the truth.
- And if you have first heard a story about a friend who has had success investing in cryptocurrency, it will also mean much more to you than a look at the statistics, the behavioral expert continues.
But it rarely ends with you scoring the same profit yourself. Because it is luck or chance that comes into play. You can't beat the market, he asserts once again.
- I would recommend that you ask yourself the question: What is it that makes me think that
I
know something about Amazon - or any other company - like people who work stocks 150 hours a week
does not
by? Even the professionals can't beat the market, he says.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Ten good days have enormous effect
It can quickly become an expensive pleasure for new investors who think they can hit the jackpot on the stock market. Because when the market suddenly doesn't do as expected, there are a lot of people who jump in and out at inopportune times.
For example, many inexperienced investors choose to sell when stock prices fall - to limit losses. But you shouldn't do that. Instead, you have to persevere through the downturn, states Anders Hartmann, CEO of Nord Investments.
- It's a bad trend, which often ends up in people losing both whole and half their fortunes, he says.
10 days, 20 percentage points
If you look, for example, at how the C25 index, which covers the 25 largest companies in Denmark, behaved in 2021, it is a good example of why entering and exiting the market can be an expensive pleasure.
Because the large fluctuations that can occur on individual days can have enormous significance.
Thus, if you were on the market for the entire period - from 1 January to 6 December 2021, when the figures are drawn - you would land on a return of 10.49 percent.
But if you were out of the market on the 10 best days, you would instead end up with a negative return of -10.86 percent.
- It is of course a theoretical example built on the fact that you go in and out of the market all year and happen to not be there on the 10 best days, but it still shows very well how important it is to stay in the market and not sell, when things go badly in periods, says Anders Hartmann.
He adds that the global stock market shows the same trend if you look back over a ten-year period.
Invest every month
So drop the fight against the market and instead let your investments be governed by when you have money available that you won't need within a number of years.
Because as an old saying in the investment industry goes: 'Time on the market beats timing on the market' - or in other words: You can't time your investments, but time will most often work for you.
Seen from a historical perspective, it has indeed been good business - but it therefore requires that you have time to wait and do not have to use the money in a year's time.
- We usually say that you must have a time horizon of at least three years. Otherwise, it will simply be too uncertain, says Anders Hartmann.
FACTS - risk profile
Good investment is boring
And when you have to choose your investments, go for index funds and not individual shares, both Anders Hartmann and Morten Münster advise. Because even if it is not necessarily as exciting to follow along, it is the surest way to profit.
- Good investment is just boring, says Morten Münster.
At the same time, he advises that you stick to passive funds, where it is a computer that makes the investments - rather than an active one, where people sit and select shares.
The latter typically costs significantly more, but the result rarely matches the bill.

title: Naja, Anna og Freja: Sådan er sex med kondom for os
subtitle: Her fortæller tre kvinder om, hvordan det føles for dem at have sex med gummi
body:
30-årige Naja Christensen, 29-årige Anna Catharina Mätzke og 23-årige Freja Hammer Selsing fortæller hver især om deres syn på sex med kondom.
Boks om de tre kvinder
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Anna: Gled af oppe i mig
- Jeg kan ikke døje kondomer. Bare det at røre ved et, når man pakker det ud. Alt det der stads - den smørelse, kondomet er fedtet ind i - nej, det er slet ikke mig. Men det er enten kondom eller at holde sig fra det frække i swingerklubben. Og det sidste vil jeg jo meget nødig.
- Så ja, kondomet skal på, når jeg er sammen med en anden mand end min faste partner. I hvert fald i forbindelse med penetrationssex og oralsex.
- Engang jeg skulle give et blowjob, forsøgte jeg mig med et stykke gummi med smag - som dog kun gjorde det endnu værre.
- Men nu er det jo ikke kun os kvinder, der synes mindre godt om brugen af gummi. Min erfaring er, at de fleste mænd helt klart helst vil uden, og en del af dem siger rent ud, at de slet ikke kan præstere med gummi på.
- Om det passer - eller de siger det med udsigten til at slippe - er lidt svært at svare på.
- Den første gang, jeg nogensinde var i Tucan Club (swingerklub, red.), havde jeg sex med en fyr, hvor kondomet smuttede af oppe i mig, og der var jeg sgu tæt på at gå i panik.
- For kunne manden ikke selv fiske det frem igen, havde jeg formentlig skullet på skadestuen. Heldigvis var han dog langfingret nok til at få det ud - en kluboplevelse, jeg helst ikke ser gentaget.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Freja: Bedre uden kondom, men ...
- I en del år har jeg næsten altid haft en primær sexpartner. Det har jeg også nu, og med ham dyrker jeg sex uden gummi på. Jeg er sikker på ham, og han er sikker på mig.
- Når det derimod kommer til sex med andre mænd, så skal der altid gummi på. Ligesom min primære sexpartner også altid bruger kondom, hvis han har sex med andre end mig. En stor tryghed og sikkerhed for os begge.
- Når det er sagt, så er sex uden kondom bare bedst. Det giver nemlig mere frihed og et meget bedre flow. Fremfor man midt i akten skal stoppe op for at komme kondom på, og/eller at gummiet en eller flere gange smutter af, når man lige hygger sig så godt.
- Jeg har dog afveget fra egne regler/foranstaltninger en gang, og det er da lidt pinligt. Her rendte jeg på en fyr, og vi ville rigtig gerne hinanden. Skulle det dog ske med kondom på, så ville det slet ikke ske. For så kunne han slet ikke, sagde han, og her vandt min lyst og liderlighed altså over fornuften.
- I min verden er penetrationssex dog kun en lille del af den store palet af dejlige og givende sexmuligheder, man kan kaste sig ud i sammen. Man kan i mange tilfælde pænt drible uden om kondomet uden at udsætte sig selv for risiko af den årsag.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Naja: Mere til den ægte vare
- Jeg er en gift kvinde, der samtidig er steriliseret, så heldigvis er det slut med at bruge kondom sammen med min mand.
- Når jeg derimod leger med andre mænd i swingerklubben eller i privat regi, så beskytter jeg naturligvis mig selv ved at benytte kondom. Men sex uden ér bare bedre. Faktisk kan det indimellem ligefrem være deprimerende med.
- For den mand, man nu er sammen med, ville med garanti kunne præstere bedre uden. Og så er der de fyre, hvor erektionen falder i selvsamme øjeblik, kondomet findes frem, og det er jo heller ikke specielt fedt for hverken ham eller mig. Så nej, jeg er på ingen måde fan.
- At give et blowjob, for slet ikke at tale om et håndjob, når manden har kondom på: Her skal der ikke ret meget til, før det smutter af, og så kan man ellers begynde helt forfra.
- Til gengæld kan kondomer da bruges til at lave ballondyr af eller måske rettere kondomdyr. Så lidt skæg og ballade kan man da få ud af de små stykker gummi.
- Sidst, men ikke mindst, så kan man som modtager rent faktisk også godt mærke - i forbindelse med penetrationssex - om manden har gummi på eller ej.
- En regnfrakkeklædt erigeret penis er meget mere glat end samme udgave uden gummi på - og helt personligt er jeg klart mest til den version, hvor man kan mærke den ægte vare.
body_en:
30-year-old Naja Christensen, 29-year-old Anna Catharina Mätzke and 23-year-old Freja Hammer Selsing each talk about their views on sex with a condom.
Box about the three women
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Anna: Slide inside me
- I can't stand condoms. Just touching one when you unwrap it. All that stuff - the lubrication the condom is soaked in - no, it's not me at all. But it's either a condom or staying away from the naughty stuff in the swinger club. And I really don't want the latter.
- So yes, the condom must be worn when I am with a man other than my regular partner. At least in connection with penetration sex and oral sex.
- Once I had to give a blowjob, I tried a piece of flavored rubber - which only made it worse.
- But now it's not just us women who think less well of the use of rubber. My experience is that most men clearly prefer to go without, and some of them say outright that they can't perform with rubber on at all.
- Whether it fits - or they say it with the prospect of escaping - is a bit difficult to answer.
- The first time I was ever in the Tucan Club (swinger club, ed.), I had sex with a guy, where the condom slipped off inside me, and I was very close to panicking.
- Because if the man couldn't fish it out himself, I would probably have had to go to the emergency room. Fortunately, however, he was long-fingered enough to get it out - a club experience I'd rather not see repeated.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Freja: Better without a condom, but ...
- For several years I have almost always had a primary sex partner. I have that too now, and with him I have sex without rubber on. I am sure of him and he is sure of me.
- On the other hand, when it comes to sex with other men, rubber must always be worn. Just like my primary sex partner also always uses a condom if he has sex with anyone other than me. A great sense of security and safety for both of us.
- Having said that, sex without a condom is simply the best. It gives more freedom and a much better flow. Instead of having to stop in the middle of the act to put on a condom and/or the rubber slipping off one or more times when you're enjoying yourself so much.
- However, I have deviated from my own rules/measures once, and it is a bit embarrassing. Here I ran into a guy, and we really wanted each other. However, if it happened with a condom on, it would not happen at all. Because then he couldn't at all, he said, and here my lust and lasciviousness won over reason.
- In my world, however, penetration sex is only a small part of the large palette of lovely and rewarding sex opportunities that you can indulge in together. In many cases, you can nicely dribble around the condom without putting yourself at risk for that reason.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Naja: More for the real thing
- I am a married woman who has also been sterilised, so luckily I have finished using condoms with my husband.
- On the other hand, when I play with other men in the swinger club or in private, I naturally protect myself by using a condom. But sex without it is just better. In fact, it can sometimes be downright depressing.
- Because the man you are now with would definitely be able to perform better without him. And then there are the guys whose erection falls at the very moment the condom is found, and it's not particularly cool for either him or me. So no, I'm not a fan by any means.
- Giving a blowjob, let alone a hand job, when the man has a condom on: It doesn't take much before it slips away, and then you can start all over again.
- On the other hand, condoms can then be used to make balloon animals out of or perhaps rather condom animals. So little trouble and trouble can be made out of the small pieces of rubber.
- Last, but not least, you as the recipient can actually feel - in connection with penetration sex - whether the man is wearing rubber or not.
- A raincoat-clad erect penis is much smoother than the same version without rubber on - and personally, I am clearly more into the version where you can feel the real thing.
