 'Sydsjællands']

title: Ekspert: Derfor kan serieforbrydere ikke stoppe
subtitle: Hvis man har begået tre så voldsomme forbrydelser, der er rejst sigtelse for, stopper man ikke af sig selv, siger en kriminalpsykolog og ekspert i profilering
body:
Den 32-årige mand, der er sigtet for at have bortført og voldtaget en 13-årig pige, er nu også sigtet for at have voldtaget og dræbt 17-årige Emilie Meng i 2016 - og for forsøg på bortførelse og knivtrusler mod en ung pige i Sorø i 2021. Han nægter sig skyldig i alle tre forhold.
Med forbehold for, at vi endnu ikke ved, om det er den sigtede, der er gerningsmanden, giver kriminalpsykolog og ekspert i profilering Charlotte Kappel sin faglige vurdering af, hvilken person der kan stå bag de voldsomme gerninger.
- Det er en person, der skal stoppes. Hvis man står bag alle tre gerninger, er det ikke noget, man kommer til i en pludselig handling. Man vil ikke stoppe af sig selv, siger hun.
- Hvorfor kan en serieforbryder ikke stoppe sig selv?
- Fordi for hver gang det vil lykkes for ham, får han mere selvtillid. En stadig stærkere idé om, at 'det her kan jeg godt'. Han har formentligt også meget store tanker om sig selv, og han begynder at tro stadigt mere på, at der aldrig er nogen, der finder ham, forklarer hun.
- Hvis han også har psykopatiske træk, giver han også sig selv ’lov' til at blive ved med det. Han får en idé om, at det er i orden, det han gør. For der sker jo ikke noget. Der er ingen, der gør noget.
-
Hvad er det for en drift, der får et menneske til at begå serieforbrydelser af denne karaktér?
- Det kan på ingen måde være en pludselig indskydelse, hvis det er tre gange, som det måske er her. Der er rigtig mange ting, jeg endnu ikke ved i den her sag, og jeg kan derfor ikke udtale mig om den specifikt – men umiddelbart vil jeg sige, at det som regel begynder langt tidligere med, at man laver noget, man ikke skal. En lettere afvigende adfærd. Man starter måske med at have grænseoverskridende adfærd over for f.eks. kvinder.
- Hvis man så er intelligent og dygtig nok til at kunne efterligne os andre, så vil man meget hurtigt finde ud af, hvad man skal gøre - og ikke gøre. De kan holde driften tilbage et stykke tid, men ikke for evigt.
Efterlader ting
- Hvis det viser sig, at en person har gjort noget så voldsomt som det her, vil det være et menneske, der er ekstremt risikovillig. Hvis man f.eks. efterlader ting i vejgrøften, er det så sløset, at der må være en årsag til det – og han kan have tænkt, at det var vigtigere at komme væk end potentielt at kunne blive afsløret.
-
Er det en psykopatisk drift?
- Det kan enten være en personlighedsforstyrrelse eller karakterafvigende adfærd, som man er god nok til at holde under lås og slå i et stykke tid. Det er sjældent, at personen formår at holde det under låg så lang tid, som man ser her i de tre forhold, der sammenkædes i sigtelsen. Der går ofte kortere tid mellem forbrydelserne.
- Hvordan når man som menneske dertil, hvor det kan ende i voldtægt, bortførelse, drab?
- Det starter som regel meget tidligt i livet med, at man har nogle forstyrrelser, som ikke bliver fundet og rettet ind. Ofte begynder det i den tidligste skolealder. På en eller anden måde har omgivelserne ikke taget ansvar og reageret eller gået imod, når han har gjort eller sagt noget, der var fuldkommen uden for accepteret adfærd.
Mørke ting indeni
- Man kan sagtens lære at være meget rar og flink – endda overdrevet flink - og samtidigt gemme på de her mørke ting indeni. Hvis man begår tre så voldsomme forbrydelser uden at blive taget, så er det, fordi man er rigtig god til at ’ligne’ os andre. Det kan man lære.
- Er der nogle fællestræk i ens opvækst, der gør, at nogle mennesker kan blive serieforbrydere?
- Der er som regel to muligheder. Den ene har vi selv stået bag som samfund, hvor vi har skabt nogle meget dysfunktionelle familier, ofte med misbrug, vold og andet i deres opvækst. Det er dem, der er langt flest af.
- Den anden er langt farligere. Det er mennesker, der er genetisk disponerede, født med en skade i bl.a. den frontale del af hjernen. Og hvis de samtidig har nemmere ved at efterligne os andre og har intelligens og evnen til at kunne tilpasse sig, kan de blive i stand til at gøre den her slags meget voldsomme forbrydelser. Men vi taler om en
meget
lille gruppe mennesker, der er skabt sådan.
Profil af en gerningsmand
Ekstra Bladet bad psykolog Charlotte Kappel om at tegne en profil af en gerningsmand, der kunne have begået de tre omtalte forbrydelser.
- Det er endnu meget nyt, at det er en sigtelse for tre forbrydelser - og derfor har jeg ikke søgt dybt ned i det, men jeg vil blandt andet sige:
- Hvis de tre forbrydelser hænger sammen, kan han være en person, hvor tilfredsstillelsen er højere end risikoen for at blive taget, og han vil blive stadig mere risikovillig, indtil han bliver stoppet. Han vil kende stederne i detaljer, og geografien vil være ekstremt vigtig for ham.
Endnu ukendte forbrydelser
- En serieforbryder, der kan undvige i så lang tid – og hvis det er over flere gerninger - vil tydeligvis være god til at 'skjule' sine følelser og spille en rolle som den flinke, pæne mand. Han vil formentligt komme fra en helt almindelig middelklassefamilie og er derfor ikke helt 'fortabt', men dygtig til at lære at opføre sig 'rigtigt og 'forkert'.
- Hvis det er den samme, der er gerningsmand i tre så voldsomme forforhold, er det sandsynligt, at han også har kunnet begå endnu ukendte forbrydelser - ud over dem, han er sigtet for.
- Han kan komme fra en familie, der er forholdsvis velfungerende og har givet det videre til børnene – men hvor der også er nogle dysfunktionelle faktorer, som f.eks. typisk en far, der har været følelsesmæssigt fjern. Og en mor, der måske har opretholdt en facade, der var vigtig at overholde, og hvor der var meget, der skulle skjules.
- Jo bedre han er til at kunne lægge låg på sine drifter og skjule mørket inde i sig selv, jo mere vil han oftest også være god til at kunne efterligne os andre. Han har undertrykt den drift og den tilfredsstillelse så længe, han overhovedet har kunnet - for så at slå til.
body_en:
The 32-year-old man, who is charged with abducting and raping a 13-year-old girl, is now also charged with raping and killing 17-year-old Emilie Meng in 2016 - and for attempted abduction and knife threats against a young girl in Sorø in 2021. He pleads not guilty in all three cases.
With the caveat that we do not yet know whether it is the accused who is the perpetrator, criminal psychologist and expert in profiling Charlotte Kappel gives her professional assessment of which person may be behind the violent acts.
- This is a person who must be stopped. If you are behind all three deeds, it is not something you come up with in a sudden action. You don't want to stop on your own, she says.
- Why can't a serial criminal stop himself?
- Because every time he succeeds, he gains more confidence. An increasingly strong idea that 'I can do this'. He probably also has very high thoughts about himself, and he begins to believe more and more that no one will ever find him, she explains.
- If he also has psychopathic traits, he also gives himself 'permission' to continue with it. He gets an idea that what he is doing is right. Because nothing happens. No one is doing anything.
-
What kind of drive is it that makes a person commit serial crimes of this nature?
- It cannot in any way be a sudden intervention if it is three times, as it may be here. There are a lot of things I still don't know about this case, and I can't therefore comment on it specifically - but I would immediately say that it usually starts much earlier with you doing something you shouldn't. A slightly deviant behavior. You might start with borderline behavior towards e.g. women.
- If you are intelligent and skilled enough to be able to imitate the rest of us, you will very quickly find out what to do - and not to do. They can hold back operations for a while, but not forever.
Leaving things behind
- If it turns out that a person has done something as violent as this, it will be a person who is extremely risk-averse. If you e.g. leaves things in the ditch, it's so wasteful that there must be a reason for it - and he may have thought that getting away was more important than potentially being exposed.
-
Is it a psychopathic drive?
- It can either be a personality disorder or deviant behavior that you are good enough to keep under lock and key for a while. It is rare that the person manages to keep it under wraps for as long as you can see here in the three circumstances linked in the charge. There is often less time between crimes.
- How do you as a person get to the point where it can end in rape, abduction, murder?
- It usually starts very early in life when you have some disturbances that are not found and corrected. Often it begins at the earliest school age. Somehow the environment has not taken responsibility and reacted or gone against when he has done or said something that was completely outside of accepted behavior.
Dark things inside
- You can easily learn to be very nice and nice - even excessively nice - and at the same time hide these dark things inside. If you commit three such violent crimes without being caught, it is because you are really good at 'looking like' the rest of us. You can learn that.
- Are there any common features in one's upbringing that make some people become serial criminals?
- There are usually two options. One we ourselves have been behind as a society, where we have created some very dysfunctional families, often with abuse, violence and other things in their upbringing. They are by far the most numerous.
- The other is far more dangerous. These are people who are genetically predisposed, born with an injury in e.g. the frontal part of the brain. And if at the same time they find it easier to imitate the rest of us and have intelligence and the ability to adapt, they may be able to commit these kinds of very violent crimes. But we are talking about one
much
small group of people who were created that way.
Profile of a perpetrator
Ekstra Bladet asked psychologist Charlotte Kappel to draw a profile of a perpetrator who could have committed the three crimes mentioned.
- It is still very new that it is a charge for three crimes - and therefore I have not delved deeply into it, but I would like to say, among other things:
- If the three crimes are connected, he may be someone where the satisfaction is higher than the risk of being caught, and he will become increasingly risk-averse until he is stopped. He will know the places in detail and geography will be extremely important to him.
Still unknown crimes
- A serial criminal who can evade for such a long time - and if it is over several crimes - will clearly be good at 'hiding' his feelings and playing the role of the nice, nice man. He will probably come from an ordinary middle-class family and is therefore not completely 'lost', but capable of learning to behave 'right and 'wrong'.
- If it is the same person who is the perpetrator in three such violent relationships, it is likely that he could also have committed as yet unknown crimes - in addition to those for which he is charged.
- He may come from a family that is relatively well-functioning and has passed it on to the children - but where there are also some dysfunctional factors, such as typically a father who has been emotionally distant. And a mother who may have maintained a facade that was important to maintain and where there was much to hide.
- The better he is at being able to put a lid on his urges and hide the darkness inside himself, the more often he will also be good at imitating the rest of us. He has suppressed that drive and that satisfaction for as long as he possibly could - and then strikes.

title: Kønsskiftet voldtægtsdømt vil afsone med kvinder
subtitle: 62-årig tidligere mand, der afsoner forvaring for voldtægter, føler sig ydmyget i fængslet
body:
En 62-årig, der biologisk er mand, men juridisk er kvinde, afsoner forvaring på ubestemt tid for grove voldtægter. Nu kræver hun at blive flyttet væk fra afsoningen sammen med mænd i fængslet, og hun vil kun visiteres nøgen i fængslet af kvindeligt personale.
Den usædvanlige sag kører ved Østre Landsret, efter at den 62-årige kun fik delvist medhold i Københavns Byret sidste år. Byretten slog fast, at personalet i Herstedvester Fængsel skal omtale fangen som ’hun’ og ’hende’, men afslog, at hun skal flyttes til en kvindeafdeling, fordi hun biologisk er mand.
Byretten sagde også god for, at hun bliver kropsvisiteret af mandligt fængselspersonale, og afgiver urinprøver i nærvær af mænd. Byretten afslog at give hende en krævet erstatning på 80.000 krorner for den tort, hun føler sig udsat for i Herstedvester Fængsel.
Må ikke gå i kjole
Den 62-årige skiftede juridisk køn til kvinde 30. marts 2015, men hun afsoner fortsat på en mandsafdeling i Herstedvester Fængsel. Ifølge advokat Julie Stage, der har anket den 62-åriges sag til landsretten, er hun utryg i fængslet, fordi tonen fra hendes mandlige medfanger ofte er hård, nedsættende og truende.
- Hun er ubekvem ved at gå i kjole på afdelingen, og hun er direkte blevet frarådet det af Kriminalforsorgen på grund af risikoen for overgreb fra mandlige medindsatte, siger advokat Julie Stage. Hun mener, det er i strid med international praksis, at indsatte i Danmark kun placeres efter biologisk køn, og at den 62-åriges menneskerettigheder bliver krænket.
- Kriminalforsorgen har et meget gammeldags og utidssvarende menneskesyn. Når man kan oprette særafdelinger for rockere og bander, kan man også oprette en særafdeling for transkønnede, siger advokaten. Hun mener, at der sidder 10-15 transkønnede afsonere i danske fængsler, og at mange af dem har det ’helt forfærdeligt’ og må gå i frivillig isolation for at kunne være i fred for de mandlige medfanger.
Bliver ydmyget
En overlæge fra Herstedvester Fængsel skriver i et notat, at hun ikke er i tvivl om, at den 62-årige ’i særlig grad føler sig ydmyget, når hun visiteres af mandligt personale, idet hendes ydre kønsorganer ikke er særligt udviklede’.
Hun er i gennemsnit blevet udsat for 46 nøgenvisitationer årligt, hvor hun skal sidde på hug, så personalet kan lede efter stoffer. Angiveligt har personalet aldrig fundet noget hos den 62-årige.
Advokat Julie Stage siger, at Kriminalforsorgen afviser at oprette en særafdeling for transkønnede, fordi de mener, det er en politisk beslutning. Det, mener hun, er forkert. Kriminalforsorgen kan selv træffe den beslutning, men direktoratet har ikke engang regnet på, hvad det vil koste.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Er hun til fare for kvindelige fanger?
Er den 62-årige kønsskiftede voldtægtsdømte mand til fare for kvindelige indsatte, hvis hun bliver flyttet til et kvindefængsel?
Det er et af de spørgsmål, som Østre Landsret skal tage stilling til under den usædvanlige sag.
Den nu 62-årige har foruden voldtægter begået røverier og brandstiftelse. Da hun fik sin første af to forvaringsdomme, skete det efter en voldtægt 4. juni 1989, hvor hun var 28 år gammel. Offeret, en sovende kvinde, blev slået i hovedet med en brosten og slæbt ud i en bil, hvor hun igen blev slået med en fyldt flaske, der knustes, og derefter blev hun voldtaget.
I fængslet blev den 62-årige først behandlet med medicin, der dæmper kønsdriften. Men det stoppede, fordi hun på grund af en sygdom havde et så lavt serum-testosteron-tal, at hun angiveligt ikke er i stand til at få rejsning.
Kan hun få rejsning?
Hun lider af en medfødt sygdom, Klinefelters syndrom, hvor hun har et ekstra X-kromoson, så hun har 47 mod normalt 46 kromosomer. Det indebærer en mangelfuld udvikling af testiklerne og en mindre mængde af det mandlige kønshormon testosteron.
Alligevel mener Kriminalforsorgen, at den 62-årige udgør en sikkerhedsrisiko for de kvindelige indsatte, hvis hun overføres til afsoning på en afdeling med biologiske kvinder. Derfor fastholder Kriminalforsorgen, at den 62-årige fortsat skal være på en mandsafdeling
Retslægerådet siger, at det ’ikke fuldstændigt’ kan afvises, at en person med et serum-testosteron på 0,35 nmol/l kan få rejsning, men at det ’ikke er sandsynligt, og at rejsningsevnen i givet fald må forventes at være yderst beskeden eller svag’.
En mentalundersøgelse har tidligere vist, at den 62-årige har en svært afvigende personlighed. Hun er ikke blevet kønsskifteopereret, som hun har bedt om siden 2015. Fængslet har ikke villet give hende udgang til operationen. I 2021 bad hun om at få adgang til kvindeligt kønshormon, men har endnu ikke fået svar.
body_en:
A 62-year-old, who is biologically male but legally female, is serving an indefinite detention for aggravated rape. Now she is demanding to be moved away from serving time with men in the prison, and she will only be searched naked in the prison by female staff.
The unusual case is running at the Eastern High Court, after the 62-year-old was only partially successful in the Copenhagen District Court last year. The district court ruled that the staff at Herstedvester Prison must refer to the prisoner as 'she' and 'her', but refused that she must be moved to a women's ward because she is biologically male.
The district court also approved that she be body searched by male prison staff and provide urine samples in the presence of men. The district court refused to give her a claimed compensation of 80,000 kroner for the tort she feels exposed to in Herstedvester Prison.
Do not wear a dress
The 62-year-old legally changed her gender to female on March 30, 2015, but she is still serving time in a male section in Herstedvester Prison. According to lawyer Julie Stage, who has appealed the 62-year-old's case to the High Court, she is insecure in prison because the tone of her male fellow prisoners is often harsh, derogatory and threatening.
- She is uncomfortable wearing a dress in the ward, and she has been directly advised against it by the Norwegian Correctional Service because of the risk of abuse from male fellow inmates, says lawyer Julie Stage. She believes that it is contrary to international practice that inmates in Denmark are only placed according to biological sex, and that the 62-year-old's human rights are being violated.
- The correctional service has a very old-fashioned and out-of-date view of people. When you can create special sections for rockers and gangs, you can also create a special section for transgender people, says the lawyer. She believes that there are 10-15 transgender prisoners serving time in Danish prisons, and that many of them feel 'absolutely terrible' and must go into voluntary isolation in order to be in peace for their male fellow prisoners.
Being humiliated
A senior doctor from Herstedvester Prison writes in a note that she has no doubt that the 62-year-old 'feels particularly humiliated when she is searched by male staff, as her external genitalia are not particularly developed'.
She has been subjected to an average of 46 strip searches a year, where she has to squat down so staff can search for drugs. Allegedly, the staff never found anything on the 62-year-old.
Lawyer Julie Stage says the Correctional Service refuses to create a special unit for transgender people because they believe it is a political decision. That, she believes, is wrong. The correctional service can make that decision itself, but the directorate has not even calculated what it will cost.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Is she a danger to female prisoners?
Is the 62-year-old transgender convicted rapist a danger to female inmates if she is moved to a women's prison?
This is one of the questions that the Eastern High Court must decide on during the unusual case.
The now 62-year-old has, in addition to rape, committed robberies and arson. When she got her first of two custodial sentences, it happened after a rape on June 4, 1989, when she was 28 years old. The victim, a sleeping woman, was hit in the head with a cobblestone and dragged out into a car, where she was again beaten with a filled bottle that was broken and then raped.
In prison, the 62-year-old was first treated with sex drive medication. But that stopped because, due to an illness, she had such a low serum testosterone level that she is reportedly unable to get an erection.
Can she get an erection?
She suffers from a congenital disease, Klinefelter's syndrome, where she has an extra X chromosome, so she has 47 instead of the normal 46 chromosomes. It involves a defective development of the testicles and a smaller amount of the male sex hormone testosterone.
Still, the Correctional Service believes that the 62-year-old poses a safety risk for the female inmates if she is transferred to a ward with biological women. Therefore, the Correctional Service maintains that the 62-year-old must continue to be in a male ward
The Council of Forensic Medicine says that it 'cannot be completely' ruled out that a person with a serum testosterone of 0.35 nmol/l can get an erection, but that it is 'not likely and that the ability to get an erection, if any, must be expected to be extremely modest or weak'.
A mental examination has previously shown that the 62-year-old has a severely deviant personality. She has not had sex reassignment surgery, which she has requested since 2015. The prison has not wanted to give her access to the surgery. In 2021, she asked for access to female sex hormone, but has not yet received a response.

title: Alex Vanopslagh: - Jeg får stadig angstanfald
subtitle: Alex Vanopslagh åbner nu op for, hvordan en psykiater hjalp ham med at få det bedre, efter at det hele ramlede for øjnene af statsministeren
body:
Den dag, hvor det går op for Alex Vanopslagh, at han ikke længere kan skjule det for offentligheden, står han på talerstolen og forsøger at læse op af sit talepapir. Det er i december 2020 under en spørgetime i folketingssalen med Mette Frederiksen.
Han ser ordene. De handler om minksagen. Men hver gang han har sagt et ord, kan han ikke huske, hvad han sagde lige før. Han er klar over, han bare står og vrøvler.
- Alt sortner, og jeg tænker: Nu falder jeg sgu om ...
Jeg var pissesyg!
Indtil da har den unge, passionerede politiker i over et halvt år kæmpet for at holde skjult for offentligheden, at han er syg af stress og får stadig flere angstanfald.
Hans familie ved det, hans medarbejdere og folketingsgruppen ved det. Men hans mål er klart: Det skal
ikke
meldes ud offentligt.
Det fortæller den nu 31-årige partileder for Liberal Alliance i dag, hvor han ser tilbage på den tid, hvor han forgæves kæmpede for at leve op til sit selvbillede som psykisk stærk og usårlig politiker på vej til succes.
- Nu kan jeg godt se, at det var fuldkommen vanvittigt, at jeg havde
så
overdrevet en frygt for konsekvensen ved at melde det ud. For hvis der er noget, jeg har svært ved at holde ud at høre på, så er det klynkeri, så det skulle jeg eddermame ikke selv gøre!
- Derfor passer jeg mit arbejde med stress og angstanfald, mens det buldrer derudad med corona og minksag, og jeg hamrer løs på statsministeren, fortæller han.
- Hvad holder dig fra at erkende, du er syg?
-
Jeg tænker, at det er noget, jeg bare skal stå igennem. Angsten går jo over igen, så jeg må bare forsøge at holde det ud. Men problemet er bare, at … det er enormt grænseoverskridende at tænke tilbage på ... men for at sige det ligeud:
- Jeg var pissesyg!
Og nu står Alex Vanopslagh så på talerstolen og hører sig selv sige:
- Undskyld ... jeg har det ikke så godt.
- Det er lige der, jeg begynder jeg at tænke, at nu er vi der, hvor jeg ikke kan skjule det længere. Jeg beslutter der, at jeg vil tage halvanden måned, hvor jeg skruer helt ned.
Alex' hjerne: Løb, løb din vej ...
I slutningen af sommerferien opdager Alex Vanopslagh, at der er noget helt galt.
- Det sker, da jeg har en barndomsven fra Struer på besøg, hvor jeg viser ham rundt på Christiansborg. Hver gang jeg fortæller ham om mit arbejde, bliver jeg svimmel. Det brænder under fødderne på mig. Det er min hjerne, der råber til min krop: Løb, løb din vej....
- Jeg har aldrig før haft det sådan, at hver eneste gang jeg taler om mit arbejde, kommer den her fornemmelse af flugt i hele kroppen og hjernen. Det er virkelig mærkeligt. Jeg ved ikke, hvad det er. Jeg har det virkelig dårligt.
Det bliver ved, og resten af ferien tager Alex op i sine svigerforældres sommerhus i Hirtshals for at få ro i kroppen.
- I sommerhuset bliver det værre. Jeg ligger en hel uge under dynen og får alle mulige betændelser og har det bare endnu mere skidt. Jeg er virkelig en stakkel. Jeg tager til København for at forsøge at komme i gang med at arbejde.
- Med ét sidder jeg bare der i min folketingslejlighed. Helt færdig og fortabt. Der går det op for mig, at jeg er for syg til at arbejde. Det kommer som et chok. Jeg er
nødt
til at arbejde.
- Hvordan føles dine angstanfald?
- Det er meget forskelligt. Det kribler og krabler i hele kroppen med en følelse af, at det handler om at komme væk. Jeg får meget hurtigere hjertebanken, får svært ved at trække vejret, og jeg får tunnelsyn. Jeg græder over det mindste, og jeg får nemt raserianfald, selv om jeg ellers ikke er særlig temperamentsfuld. Spændingerne i nakken bliver så voldsomme, at jeg har svært ved at holde mit hoved oprejst. Det er hele systemet, der er ramt.
Alex går derfor til lægen, der siger, at han skal sygemelde sig.
- Det var udelukket. Jeg havde alt for travlt. Men det blev svært og endnu mere stressende også at skulle håndtere stressen, der skubbede til angsten – og samtidig være partileder.
- Jeg havde det nogle gange, som om mit hoved blev presset ned. At det spænder i hele mit hoved, og jeg er overdrevet lyd- og lysfølsom. Jeg havde svært ved at finde ro i kampen for at blive rask, fortæller Alex, der valgte at søge hjælp og komme i et længere forløb hos en erhvervspsykolog.
Psykiater hjalp mod angsten
- Psykologen gav mig nogle gode råd, som jeg dog først kunne bruge, da jeg begyndte at blive rask. Jeg prøvede også terapi, akupunktur og til sidst psykiater. En psykiater har nogle andre redskaber i sin værktøjskasse, der gav mig nok ro nok på systemet, til at jeg kunne restituere og finde ud af, hvad der var stress, og hvad der var angst. Og til at finde ud af, at når jeg havde angst, så var det var min hjerne, der gik i stykker. At jeg var i konstant kampberedskab. Men det begyndte stille og roligt at vende.
- Har du stadig angstanfald?
- Ja, det ligger latent i mig og popper op en gang imellem. Det sker især i meget pressede situationer, hvor jeg ikke får nok søvn.
- Jeg havde også nogle dage i valgkampen, hvor de dukkede op. Men modsat hvor jeg var syg, så ved jeg nu, at når jeg skruer ned, får jeg det bedre. Tidligere havde jeg det bare dårligt, og det var ikke sjovt at gå på arbejde,
- Er det sjovt nu?
- Ja, meget. Men jeg er meget bevidst om, at nedturen også kommer en dag. Jeg har lært, at det er en del af rejsen, som jeg må acceptere.
Ville være verdens bedste
Det har taget år for Alex Vanopslagh at slå sig til tåls med, at der også vil være nedture, fejl og mangler i hans liv.
- Hvorfor er det så svært at acceptere, der også vil være nedture?
- Jeg tror, det kommer fra, at jeg altid har haft et stort behov for at vise hele verden, at jeg er verdens bedste. Så hver gang der var spørgetime hos statsministeren - eller holdes en tale til det ene eller andet, så skulle det være mit livs præstation, mit livs tale. Jeg måtte endelig ikke genbruge budskaber. Hver gang skulle det være nyt og originalt. Det sled så meget, at jeg er blevet nødt til at lære mig selv, at 90 procent er godt nok.
- Og det sjove er, at der er ingen, der kan se forskel.
-
Hvorfra kommer din angst for at tabe?
- Jeg havde den også som barn, hvor jeg trænede karate på ret højt niveau. Der var det præstationsangst, der gjorde, at jeg aldrig blev blandt de bedste. Når vi trænede med landsholdstruppen, kunne jeg slå de bedste – men til stævner tabte jeg altid. På trods af at det blev indprentet i os igen og igen, at  'man skal turde tabe for at vinde'. Men jeg fattede ikke en skid! Jeg var 13-14 år, og jeg ville bare vinde.
- Nu forstår jeg det. Frygten for at tabe er ødelæggende.
- Hvad har det lært dig?
- Som leder har jeg lavet rigtig mange fejl. I begyndelsen var jeg dårlig til at tage konflikter og til at give feedback. Jeg har ikke kunnet håndtere min frygt for at tage de forkerte beslutninger og min frygt for ikke at kunne leve op til andres og mine egne forventninger.
- Jeg har også frygtet den risiko, der var for, at Liberal Alliance ville dø på på min vagt. Det var der udsigt til i lang tid. Jeg ved ikke hvordan, men på en eller anden måde fandt jeg ind til en accept, at den risiko
er
der. Og sådan er det! Det nytter ikke noget at hænge fast i frygten for at tabe.
- Jeg tror, at det her forløb har gjort mig bedre til at kunne se frygten i øjnene og erkende det, jeg dårlig til, siger han og tilføjer:
- Det går jo også godt. Men det er ikke sikkert, jeg ser sådan på det, når det går rigtig dårligt.
Herunder kan du læse videre om, hvad der findes inde i Alex Vanopslag, politikeren med den høje selvtillid, det lave selvværd og de lange arme:
(IKL 10.05)Høj selvtillid, lavt selvværd og lange arme
Vidste du det om Vanopslagh?
Blå Bog Alex Vanopslagh
Vanopslagh om Boligsagen
body_en:
The day when it dawns on Alex Vanoplagh that he can no longer hide it from the public, he stands on the podium and tries to read from his speech paper. It is in December 2020 during question time in the parliament hall with Mette Frederiksen.
He sees the words. They are about the mink case. But every time he has said a word, he can't remember what he said just before. He's aware, he's just rambling.
- Everything goes black, and I think: Now I'm going to fall over...
I was pissed!
Until then, the young, passionate politician has struggled for more than half a year to keep hidden from the public that he is ill from stress and is having more and more anxiety attacks.
His family knows it, his employees and the parliamentary group know it. But his goal is clear: It must
does not
announced publicly.
This is what the now 31-year-old Liberal Alliance party leader says today, when he looks back on the time when he struggled in vain to live up to his self-image as a mentally strong and invulnerable politician on the way to success.
- Now I can see that it was completely crazy that I had
so
exaggerated a fear of the consequence of reporting it. Because if there's anything I can't stand to listen to, it's whining, so I better not do that myself!
- That's why I manage my work with stress and anxiety attacks, while it's rumbling out there with corona and the mink case, and I'm hammering away at the prime minister, he says.
- What keeps you from recognizing that you are ill?
-
I think it's something I just have to get through. The anxiety goes away again, so I just have to try to endure it. But the problem is just that ... it's hugely transgressive to think back on ... but to put it bluntly:
- I was pissed!
And now Alex Vanoplagh stands on the podium and hears himself say:
- Sorry... I'm not feeling so well.
- That's when I start to think that now we're at the point where I can't hide it anymore. I decide there that I want to take a month and a half where I turn it down completely.
Alex's brain: Run, run your way...
At the end of the summer vacation, Alex Vanoplasgh discovers that something is very wrong.
- It happens when I have a childhood friend from Struer visiting, where I show him around Christiansborg. Every time I tell him about my work, I get dizzy. It burns under my feet. It's my brain shouting to my body: Run, run your way....
- I have never before had the feeling that every single time I talk about my work, this feeling of flight comes through my whole body and brain. It's really strange. I do not know what it is. I feel really bad.
It continues, and for the rest of the holiday, Alex goes up to his parents-in-law's summer house in Hirtshals to relax.
- In the summer house it gets worse. I lie under the covers for a whole week and get all sorts of infections and just feel even worse. I really am poor. I'm going to Copenhagen to try to start working.
- All of a sudden I'm just sitting there in my parliamentary apartment. Completely finished and lost. It dawns on me that I am too ill to work. It comes as a shock. I am
need
to work.
- How do your anxiety attacks feel?
- It's very different. It tingles and crawls throughout the body with a feeling that it is about getting away. My heart beats much faster, I have trouble breathing, and I get tunnel vision. I cry over the slightest thing and I throw tantrums easily, even though I'm not very temperamental otherwise. The tension in the neck becomes so violent that I have difficulty keeping my head upright. The whole system is affected.
Alex therefore goes to the doctor, who says he must call in sick.
- That was out of the question. I was too busy. But it became difficult and even more stressful to also have to deal with the stress that pushed the anxiety - and at the same time be party leader.
- I sometimes felt as if my head was being pressed down. That it spans my entire head and I am excessively sensitive to sound and light. I had difficulty finding peace in the struggle to get well, says Alex, who chose to seek help and undergo a longer course with an occupational psychologist.
Psychiatrists helped with the anxiety
- The psychologist gave me some good advice, which I could only use when I started to recover. I also tried therapy, acupuncture and finally a psychiatrist. A psychiatrist has some other tools in his toolbox that gave me enough peace of mind to allow me to recover and figure out what was stress and what was anxiety. And to find out that when I had anxiety, it was my brain that broke. That I was in constant combat readiness. But things slowly began to turn around.
- Do you still have anxiety attacks?
- Yes, it lies latent in me and pops up once in a while. It happens especially in very stressful situations where I don't get enough sleep.
- I also had a few days during the election campaign when they appeared. But unlike when I was sick, I now know that when I cut back, I feel better. Before I just felt bad and it wasn't fun to go to work,
- Is it fun now?
- Yes very. But I am very aware that the downturn will also come one day. I have learned that it is a part of the journey that I must accept.
Would be the best in the world
It has taken years for Alex Vanoplasgh to come to terms with the fact that there will also be setbacks, mistakes and shortcomings in his life.
- Why is it so difficult to accept that there will also be downturns?
- I think it comes from the fact that I have always had a great need to show the whole world that I am the world's best. So every time there was question time with the Prime Minister - or a speech was given to one or the other, it had to be the achievement of my life, the speech of my life. I finally didn't have to reuse messages. Each time it had to be new and original. It wore off so much that I have had to teach myself that 90 percent is good enough.
- And the funny thing is that no one can tell the difference.
-
Where does your fear of losing come from?
- I also had it as a child, when I trained karate at a fairly high level. There was the performance anxiety that made me never be among the best. When we trained with the national team squad, I could beat the best - but at competitions I always lost. Despite it being instilled in us over and over again that  'one must dare to lose to win'. But I didn't get it! I was 13-14 years old and I just wanted to win.
- Now I understand. The fear of losing is devastating.
- What has it taught you?
- As a manager, I have made a lot of mistakes. In the beginning, I was bad at taking conflicts and giving feedback. I have not been able to deal with my fear of making the wrong decisions and my fear of not being able to live up to other people's and my own expectations.
- I also feared the risk that the Liberal Alliance would die on my watch. This was expected for a long time. I don't know how, but somehow I found myself accepting that risk
is
there. And that is how it is! There is no point in getting stuck in the fear of losing.
- I think that this course has made me better able to face fear and recognize what I'm bad at, he says and adds:
- It's also going well. But it's not safe, I look at it that way when things go really badly.
Below you can read more about what is inside Alex Vanopglag, the politician with high self-confidence, low self-esteem and long arms:
(IKL 10.05) High self-confidence, low self-esteem and long arms
Did you know about Vanoplagh?
Blue Book Alex Vanoplagh
Misinformation about the housing case

title: Voldsom succes: 'Hun får to orgasmer på tre sider'
subtitle: Erotica-bogserien 'Fifty Shades' åbnede op for et helt nyt sexmarked, men blev også beskrevet som 'vold med samtykke' og 'følelsesmæssigt og seksuelt partnermisbrug'
body:
Dansk pornoforsker har beskæftiget sig indgående med bogserien 'Fifty Shades', der beviste, at eksplicit sex også kan sælges til kvinder.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Den danske pornoforsker Sidsel Harder har blandt meget andet beskæftiget sig indgående med bogserien 'Fifty Shades', som blandede 'lak og læder' med 'prinsen på den hvide hest' og dermed illustrerede, at eksplicit sex også kan sælges til kvinder.
'Fifty Shades'-serien er det mest kendte bud på såkaldt erotika, der ligesom porno er lavet for at ophidse.
- Det er spændende, fordi det bevæger sig ind i populærkulturen, siger Sidsel Harder, som er sociolog fra Københavns Universitet, ph.d. og lige nu arbejder som international postdoc-stipendiat på Antwerpen Universitet i Belgien. Hun har netop udgivet bogen 'Porno', der er en del af serien 'Tænkepauser' fra Aarhus Universitetsforlag.
Ekstra Bladet har fået lov til at bringe et mindre uddrag fra bogen, og herunder kan du læse stykket, hvor Sidsel Harder blandt andet forklarer, hvorfor 'Fifty Shades'-serien endte som en gigantisk succes.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Fra 'Porno' af Sidsel Harder:
Ud af skyggerne
Christian Grey sikrer sig Anastasia Steeles udtrykkelige samtykke, inden han hamrer sig helt op i hende, river gennem hendes mødom og ser triumferende ned på hende. Hun skriger og tigger om mere, mens hun får to orgasmer på tre sider.
Scenen er den første af mange dampende udpenslinger i den engelske erotikserie 'Fifty Shades' fra 2011-12, som er skrevet af den britiske forfatterinde E.L. James.
Bogen er det mest kendte bud på såkaldt erotika, der ligesom porno er lavet for at ophidse, men oftere er båret af ord end billeder, er mindre eksplicit og mere fokuseret på fortællingen end de hårde pornofilm.
Akten mellem Steele og Grey var som taget ud af en klassisk pornofilm: Han er stor, og hun er stram, fingersex bliver til missionærstilling, ja, selv moneyshottets mandlige sprøjt og kvindelige suk er med.
Det nye var de mange læsere, for bøgerne slog selv Harry Potter som de mest solgte i England.
Ifølge en repræsentativ amerikansk markedsanalyse var det især kvinder, der købte de skyggefulde fortællinger. Mange gjorde det endda via en Kindle, helt anonymt og uden at skulle reklamere med deres brug af porno i den lokale boghandel.
Det særlige ved 'Fifty Shades' er netop brugerne og brugen. Læserne kunne selv eksperimentere med at genopføre sexscenerne hjemme i soveværelset med en buffet af sexlegetøj med seriens logo.
Se traileren for 'Fifty Shades: I mørket' fra 2017 her:
Trailer: Første fulde trailer til 'Fifty shades of Grey 2'
Et nyt sexmarked henvendte sig direkte til kvinder under overskriften 'seksuelt velvære'. Og medierne pustede til ilden ved at udnævne kvinder til en ny forbrugergruppe af seksuelle produkter i pastelnuancer, bløde former og miljørigtige materialer.
Mediernes omtale spillede en central rolle, da bog og merchandise skulle markedsføres, uden nogen dog kan påstå, at de ligefrem reklamerede for nogen af delene.
På en enkelt sommer skrev den britiske presse over 100 artikler, som generelt sablede den første bog ned og beskrev den med det nedladende udtryk 'husmorporno'.
Her var tilsyneladende en fantasi, der var så tam, at selv hjemmegående kvinder kunne være med.
Den polske litterat Ewa Kowal har i stedet beskrevet 'Fifty Shades' som 'ejendomsporno', der forfører ved hjælp af malende billeder af store huse og overdådig indretning – og hvor Grey gør Steele til en del af sin personlige ejendomsportefølje.
Men kritikken handlede ikke kun om latterligt dårligt sprog, flade karakterer og en papirtynd handling, for den britiske avis The Guardian kaldte ligefrem bogen for halvtreds nuancer af kvindemisbrug.
Starten på en samtale
Sexscenerne i Fifty Shades er spundet ind i en historie om en gudesmuk rigmand, som på grund af barndomstraumer selvmedicinerer sig ved være den dominerende part i BDSM-rollespil.
I bøgerne er der dog snarere tale om silkebløde bind for øjnene, håndjern og lidt pisk end hård smerte, åndedrætskontrol og grænseoverskridende fornedrelse. Alligevel befinder bogen sig inden for en seksuel leg, som forfatter og BDSM-underviser Mollena Williams-Haas har karakteriseret som 'vold med samtykke'.
Ikke desto mindre karakteriserede et amerikansk studie fra 2013 næsten samtlige af bogens scener mellem Christian Grey og Anastasia Steele som følelsesmæssigt og seksuelt partnermisbrug.
Samme forskere påviste året efter en statistisk sammenhæng mellem læserne af 'Fifty Shades' og kvinder, som havde oplevet, at deres partner havde råbt ad dem eller sendt dem ubehagelige beskeder.
Samtidig viste et britisk studie af kvindelige læseres reaktioner på 'Fifty Shades', at bøgerne både blev oplevet som seksuelt stimulerende – og for tamme.
En stor del af de kvindelige læsere angav godt nok, at bogen tændte dem, men de pointerede også, at den slet ikke tændte dem nok. Hvor nogle fandt sexscenerne overflødige, følte andre sig snydt for analsex.
I deres anonyme svar forklarede mange, at de kun begyndte på bogen, fordi de havde hørt, hvor dårlig den var, og bare gerne ville kunne snakke med.
Se traileren for 'Fifty Shades: Fri' fra 2018 her:
Trailer: Fifty Shades of Grey 3, Freed
Det er netop i alle de modsætninger, de britiske forskere finder et kønspolitisk potentiale i fænomenet.
Bøgerne gjorde det lettere for kvinder at forholde sig nysgerrigt til sex, både bag en e-bogslæser, der kan holdes med én hånd, og i fælles samtale med andre kvinder.
De er ikke enten gode eller dårlige for kvinder – ligesom porno i det hele taget.
De er derimod en indgang til at tale om, hvad det er for en smerte og nydelse, romantik og kvælertag, som kvinder efterspørger, og hvordan de lyster kan udvikle sig hele livet igennem.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
body_en:
Danish porn researcher has dealt extensively with the book series 'Fifty Shades', which proved that explicit sex can also be sold to women.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Among other things, the Danish porn researcher Sidsel Harder has dealt extensively with the book series 'Fifty Shades', which mixed 'lacquer and leather' with 'the prince on the white horse' and thus illustrated that explicit sex can also be sold to women.
The 'Fifty Shades' series is the best-known take on so-called erotica, which, like porn, is made to excite.
- It is exciting because it is moving into popular culture, says Sidsel Harder, who is a sociologist from the University of Copenhagen, PhD. and right now works as an international postdoctoral fellow at the University of Antwerp in Belgium. She has just published the book 'Porno', which is part of the series 'Tønkepauser' from Aarhus University Publishing.
Ekstra Bladet has been allowed to bring a small extract from the book, and below you can read the piece in which Sidsel Harder explains, among other things, why the 'Fifty Shades' series ended up as a gigantic success.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
From 'Porno' by Sidsel Harder:
Out of the shadows
Christian Gray secures Anastasia Steele's express consent before ramming all the way inside her, ripping through her virginity and looking down on her triumphantly. She screams and begs for more as she has two orgasms in three pages.
The scene is the first of many steamy outtakes in the English erotic series 'Fifty Shades' from 2011-12, which was written by the British author E.L. James.
The book is the most well-known take on so-called erotica, which, like porn, is made to excite, but is more often carried by words than images, is less explicit and more focused on the narrative than the hard porn films.
The act between Steele and Gray was like something out of a classic porn movie: He's big and she's tight, finger sex turns into a missionary position, yes, even the moneyshot's male squirts and female sighs are included.
The new thing was the many readers, because the books beat even Harry Potter as the most sold in England.
According to a representative American market analysis, it was especially women who bought the shady stories. Many even did it via a Kindle, completely anonymously and without having to advertise their use of porn in the local bookstore.
The special thing about 'Fifty Shades' is precisely the users and the use. Readers could themselves experiment with re-enacting the sex scenes at home in the bedroom with a buffet of sex toys with the series' logo.
Watch the trailer for 'Fifty Shades: In the Dark' from 2017 here:
Trailer: First full trailer for 'Fifty shades of Gray 2'
A new sex market aimed directly at women under the heading of 'sexual well-being'. And the media fueled the fire by naming women as a new consumer group of sexual products in pastel shades, soft shapes and environmentally friendly materials.
The media coverage played a central role, as the book and merchandise had to be marketed, without anyone claiming that they directly advertised any of the parts.
In a single summer, the British press wrote over 100 articles generally disparaging the first book and describing it with the condescending term 'housewife porn'.
Here was apparently a fantasy so tame that even housewives could join in.
The Polish literati Ewa Kowal has instead described 'Fifty Shades' as 'property porn', seducing with the help of painterly images of large houses and lavish furnishings - and where Gray makes Steele part of his personal property portfolio.
But the criticism was not only about ridiculously bad language, flat characters and a paper-thin plot, because the British newspaper The Guardian called the book fifty shades of misogyny.
The start of a conversation
The sex scenes in Fifty Shades are spun into a story about a handsome rich man who, due to childhood trauma, self-medicates by being the dominant party in BDSM roleplay.
In the books, however, it is more about silky blindfolds, handcuffs and a bit of whipping than severe pain, breath control and borderline humiliation. Yet the book is situated within a sexual game that author and BDSM educator Mollena Williams-Haas has characterized as 'consensual violence'.
Nevertheless, a 2013 American study characterized almost all of the book's scenes between Christian Gray and Anastasia Steele as emotional and sexual partner abuse.
The same researchers the following year demonstrated a statistical correlation between the readers of 'Fifty Shades' and women who had experienced that their partner had shouted at them or sent them unpleasant messages.
At the same time, a British study of female readers' reactions to 'Fifty Shades' showed that the books were experienced as both sexually stimulating – and too tame.
A large proportion of the female readers indicated that the book turned them on, but they also pointed out that it did not turn them on enough at all. Where some found the sex scenes superfluous, others felt cheated of anal sex.
In their anonymous responses, many explained that they only started the book because they had heard how bad it was and just wanted to be able to talk.
Watch the trailer for 'Fifty Shades: Free' from 2018 here:
Trailer: Fifty Shades of Gray 3, Freed
It is precisely in all the contradictions that the British researchers find a gender political potential in the phenomenon.
The books made it easier for women to be curious about sex, both behind an e-book reader that can be held with one hand, and in joint conversation with other women.
They are not either good or bad for women – just like porn in general.
Rather, they are an entry point to talk about what kind of pain and pleasure, romance and stranglehold women demand, and how those desires can develop throughout life.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
ner_clusters:

 'Harry Potter' 'Københavns Universitet' '. L' 'Mollena Williams' 'Porno'

title: Politiets foto-fup: De må slet ikke
subtitle: Ifølge to eksperter er nummerpladescannere i konflikt med både retten til privatliv og GDPR
body:
Hvis du gennem tiden er blevet optaget med en af politiets smarte automatisk nummerpladescanner, så kan det være sket i konflikt med retten til privatliv og GDPR.
For selvom de automatiske nummerpladerscannere, som går under navnet ANPG, er blevet rost for at være smarte til at få fat i biltyve og afsløre forsikringssvindel, så tager de også billeder af førerens ansigt.
Og det kan være et brud på reglerne,
skriver tech-mediet Radar
på baggrund af et interview med to jurister, der har speciale i persondata.
’Grundproblemet med ANPG-bekendtgørelsen er, man ikke kan se eller læse sig frem til, at disse kameraer også tager billeder af føreren af bilen. Det kan man ikke læse ud af loven’, siger Tanja Kammersgaard Christensen, der har skrevet ph.d.-afhandling om de retlige rammer for politiets overvågning og er adjunkt ved Aalborg Universitet,
til Radar
.
Bagfra i Sverige og Norge
Ifølge Tanja Kammersgaard Christensen er loven ikke er konkret nok, og derfor er der på nuværende tidspunkt ikke hjemmel til at tage billedet af førerens ansigt.
Hun mener derfor, at det skal forklares specifikt i loven, ’hvorfor det er nødvendigt at tage et billede af føreren’.
I både Norge og Sverige har de angrebet problemet bagfra. Bogstavelig talt.
Her tager man nemlig billeder af bilens bagerste nummerplade, så man fuldstændig slipper for ansigter.
Rigspolitiet er endnu ikke vendt tilbage på henvendelsen fra Radar om, hvorfor man ikke bruger samme metode som i de andre nordiske lande.
body_en:
If you have been recorded over time with one of the police's smart automatic license plate scanners, this may have occurred in conflict with the right to privacy and the GDPR.
Because although the automatic license plate scanners, which go by the name ANPG, have been praised for being smart at catching car thieves and detecting insurance fraud, they also take pictures of the driver's face.
And it may be a violation of the rules,
writes the tech media Radar
on the basis of an interview with two lawyers who specialize in personal data.
'The basic problem with the ANPG order is that you cannot see or read that these cameras also take pictures of the driver of the car. You cannot read that out of the law', says Tanja Kammersgaard Christensen, who has written a PhD thesis on the legal framework for police surveillance and is an assistant professor at Aalborg University,
to Radar
.
From behind in Sweden and Norway
According to Tanja Kammersgaard Christensen, the law is not specific enough, and therefore there is currently no authority to take a picture of the driver's face.
She therefore believes that it must be explained specifically in the law, 'why it is necessary to take a picture of the driver'.
In both Norway and Sweden, they have attacked the problem from behind. Literally.
Here you take pictures of the car's rear number plate, so you completely avoid faces.
The National Police has not yet responded to Radar's inquiry as to why they do not use the same method as in the other Nordic countries.

title: Frikendt efter otte måneder: Blev jurist bag tremmer
subtitle: Måtte skrive sit speciale i IT-jura i hånden, mens hans varetægtsfængsling blev forlænget gang på gang
body:
Johan var tæt på at være færdig som jurist efter fem års hårdt slid og var flyttet ind hos sin kæreste på Østerbro nogle måneder forinden.
Han havde lige hentet sin datter i børnehaven, og da det ringede på døren, troede han, at det var pakkeposten.
I stedet stod der to politifolk med en besked, der ændrede hans liv.
De havde fundet 54 kilo hash i hans lejlighed på Amager, som han var fraflyttet og i gang med at renovere for at sælge. Og nu var han anholdt.
Det blev starten på otte måneder og tre dage bag tremmer, 23 timer alene i cellen med en times gårdtur.
Hans svoger indrømmede fra starten, at det var ham, der havde misbrugt den nøgle, som Johan havde lagt som reserve hos sin søster og ham, og havde brugt lejligheden som skjulested for store mængder hash. Svogeren havde også forklaret til politiet, at Johan ikke vidste noget om det. Det fremgår af dommen.
Men Johans varetægtsfængsling blev bare forlænget gang på gang.
Johan er ikke hans rigtige navn. Selv om han blev pure frifundet i slutningen af september sidste år og først der kom på fri fod igen, er han bange for, at sagen kaster en ubehagelig skygge over hans fremtidige karriere.
Han gav fra starten politiet lov til ransagning, gav dem koden til sin telefon, svarede på deres spørgsmål. Lige bortset fra på hvem der havde adgang til lejligheden på Amager.´
Ren autopilot
– Det var jo min familie, der havde adgang, og jeg havde ikke lyst til at pege fingre, når jeg ikke vidste noget om, hvad der var sket, siger han.
Allerede før grundlovsforhøret bekræftede han dog, at svogeren kom i lejligheden, da han fik forevist et af politiets observationsbilleder.
Artikel fortsætter herunder...
Fejlagtig fængsling
Han kan måske godt forstå, at han blev fængslet i grundlovsforhøret, fordi det trods alt var hans lejlighed, deres forklaringer skulle efterprøves, og vidner skulle afhøres.
Men herefter føler han, at han blev forlænget på automatpilot.
– Det var min fornemmelse, at det ikke tog ret hårdt på dem, at jeg sad der. Det virkede meget fabriksagtigt, siger han.
– Hver gang havde de en ny grund til hvorfor. Så var de ikke færdig med at udlæse min telefon - selv om de havde de koder, de skulle bruge. Så ville de tjekke for dna. Så var det fingeraftryk.
– Gjorde det noget ved dig, at den ene måned tog den næste?
– Jeg tror, jeg blev bitter. Og jeg kunne ikke se, hvor det kød, politiet manglede, skulle komme fra. De havde tjekket alting på det tidspunkt.
– Jeg synes jo, at sagen er ganske alvorlig med et ret omfattende kvantum af hash, men den rolle, som de tiltalte mig for at have haft, sammenholdt med de beviser - eller manglende beviser - de havde, var det vanvittigt uproportionalt.
Imens måtte Johan skrive sit jura-speciale i hånden bag tremmer.
– Sidder du tilbage med følelsen af, at systemet ikke forstår alvoren af at sidde fængslet?
– Helt klart. Jeg vil anbefale dem at prøve det. Jeg mødte et par stykker, som blev frifundet, som knækkede ret meget. Man kunne høre, at de græd på cellen.
– Jeg havde heldigvis et projekt, jeg kunne kaste mig over. Men dem, som bare sad med deres tanker og fjernsyn med 19 kanaler, de havde det hårdt.
Svoger leverede hash til Pusher Street
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Til eksamen med civile betjente
Ikke alene gik Johan glip af sin datters første skoledag, mens han sad bag tremmer.
Han var også tæt på at få spoleret sin jobmæssige fremtid, fordi han skulle aflevere speciale i IT-ret.
– Jeg har kæmpet i fem år med at blive cand. jur., så det var ikke noget, jeg havde tænkt mig at opgive. Men hvis jeg ikke havde haft min kæreste, så var det aldrig blevet til noget, siger han og konstaterer, at det var ret tydeligt, at fængslet ikke var gearet til at håndtere den situation.
Kæresten holdt møder med hans vejleder på hans vegne, fandt artikler og printede 900 sider, som både forsvandt og var længe undervejs, fordi politiet først skulle kigge dem igennem for skjulte beskeder, fordi han havde brev- og besøgskontrol.
Og så skrev han de hundrede sider plus fodnoter i hånden på cellen, som blev sendt ud til kæresten, der skrev dem ind på computer.
Men det var også en kamp at komme ud og forsvare specialet, og han er overbevist om, at det kun var takket være hans kæreste, at det gik igennem.
Han endte med at få lov til at møde op på universitet uden håndjern med to betjente i civil, der dog alligevel stak ud med deres øresnegle.
– Folk måtte tro, at jeg enten var meget farlig eller meget vigtig. Men de holdt sig i skyggen, og jeg tror ikke rigtig, at censor og eksaminator opdagede noget, fortæller han.
Han bestod med et syvtal.
– Jeg tror, at det er det første IT-ret-speciale, der er skrevet uden internet-adgang overhovedet, siger han med galgenhumor.
Men han kalder det også skræmmende.
– At man kan komme ind som fuldstændig uskyldig, og de kan smadre ens liv på så tyndt et grundlag - så kan det jo næsten ske for alle. Og du har ikke nogen mulighed for at gøre noget, når du sidder derinde. Dine regninger og alt muligt andet hober sig bare op. Kreditorerne aner jo ikke, at du bare sidder der og glor.
Afvist af landsretten
body_en:
Johan was close to graduating as a lawyer after five years of hard work and had moved in with his girlfriend in Østerbro a few months before.
He had just picked up his daughter from kindergarten, and when the doorbell rang, he thought it was the parcel post.
Instead, there were two police officers with a message that changed his life.
They had found 54 kilos of hashish in his apartment in Amager, which he had moved out of and was in the process of renovating in order to sell. And now he was under arrest.
It was the start of eight months and three days behind bars, 23 hours alone in the cell with an hour's farm trip.
His brother-in-law admitted from the start that it was he who had misused the key that Johan had left as a spare with his sister and him, and had used the apartment as a hiding place for large quantities of hashish. The brother-in-law had also explained to the police that Johan knew nothing about it. This appears from the judgment.
But Johan's detention was just extended time and time again.
Johan is not his real name. Although he was acquitted at the end of September last year and only then went free again, he is afraid that the case casts an unpleasant shadow over his future career.
From the start, he gave the police permission to search, gave them the code to his phone, answered their questions. Just apart from who had access to the apartment in Amager.´
Pure autopilot
- After all, it was my family who had access, and I didn't want to point fingers when I didn't know anything about what had happened, he says.
Even before the constitutional hearing, however, he confirmed that the brother-in-law came to the apartment when he was shown one of the police's surveillance photos.
Article continues below...
Wrongful imprisonment
He may well understand that he was imprisoned in the constitutional hearing because, after all, it was his occasion, their explanations had to be tested and witnesses had to be questioned.
But after that he feels that he was extended on automatic pilot.
- It was my feeling that it didn't take too much of a toll on them that I was sitting there. It seemed very factory-like, he says.
- Each time they had a new reason why. Then they didn't finish reading my phone - even though they had the codes they needed. Then they wanted to check for dna. Then it was fingerprints.
- Did it affect you that one month took the next?
- I think I became bitter. And I couldn't see where the meat the police were missing was going to come from. They had checked everything at that point.
- I do think that the case is quite serious with a fairly large amount of hashish, but the role that they accused me of having, compared to the evidence - or lack of evidence - that they had, it was crazy disproportionate.
Meanwhile, Johan had to write his law thesis by hand behind bars.
- Are you left with the feeling that the system does not understand the seriousness of being in prison?
- Clearly. I would recommend them to try it. I met a few that were acquitted that broke quite a lot. You could hear them crying in the cell.
- Fortunately, I had a project I could throw myself into. But those who just sat with their thoughts and television with 19 channels, they had a hard time.
Brother-in-law delivered hash to Pusher Street
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
For exams with civil officers
Not only did Johan miss his daughter's first day of school while he was behind bars.
He was also close to having his job future ruined because he had to submit a thesis in IT law.
- I have struggled for five years to become a candidate. jur., so it wasn't something I was going to give up. But if I hadn't had my girlfriend, then it would never have come to anything, he says and states that it was quite clear that the prison was not equipped to deal with that situation.
The girlfriend held meetings with his supervisor on his behalf, found articles and printed 900 pages, which both disappeared and were a long time coming, because the police first had to look through them for hidden messages, because he had mail and visitor control.
And then he wrote the hundred pages plus footnotes by hand on the cell, which were sent out to the girlfriend, who typed them into the computer.
But it was also a struggle to come out and defend the thesis, and he is convinced that it was only thanks to his girlfriend that it went through.
He ended up being allowed to show up at the university without handcuffs with two plainclothes officers, who nonetheless stuck out their ear plugs.
- People had to think that I was either very dangerous or very important. But they stayed in the shadows, and I don't really think that the censor and examiner discovered anything, he says.
He passed with a seven.
- I think it is the first IT law thesis that has been written without internet access at all, he says with gallows humour.
But he also calls it scary.
- That you can come in as completely innocent, and they can destroy your life on such a thin basis - it can happen to almost everyone. And you don't have a chance to do anything when you're sitting in there. Your bills and everything else just pile up. Creditors have no idea that you just sit there and stare.
Rejected by the High Court

title: Luksuskonkurs: Kræver millioner af håndlæserhustru
subtitle: Det kan blive en dyr fornøjelse for Louisa Cocco Dalgaard, at hun i flere år fik en god løn fra Sinitone, uden hun tilsyneladende arbejdede i selskabet, der havde hendes mand som direktør
body:
Ved du noget? Så skriv til journalisterne bag historien
her
.
3.463.565,49 kroner.
Så meget skal Louisa Cocco Dalgaard betale tilbage til konkursboet efter Sinitone, hvis det står til kuratorerne, som i øjeblikket forsøger at rydde op i kollapset efter høreapparatselskabet. Det kan Ekstra Bladet nu afsløre.
Hendes mand, Rasmus Bjerregaard, var adm. direktør og ejede 70 procent af Sinitone, der også er kendt som Hørebil, som frem til konkursen drev kørende høreklinikker, hvor man kørte ud til kunden, foretog en høretest og udleverede et høreapparat. Omkring årsskiftet kollapsede selskabet dog,
efter ejerne havde levet i luksus
, og hvor Louisa Cocco Dalgaard
selv havde modtaget en kæmpeløn
.
FAKTA Sinitones millionkollaps
Ekstra Bladet har fået aktindsigt i den seneste redegørelse, som de to kuratorer, Christian Jul Madsen fra Kromann Reumert og Henrik Selchau Poulsen fra Bruun Hjejle, har sendt ud til dem, som mener at have penge til gode hos Sinitone. Her fremgår det, at:
'Kuratellet har foreløbig sendt påkrav om betaling af et af kuratellet opgjort krav på 3.463.565,49 kr., som foreløbig delvist bestrides af skyldneren. Kravet vedrører lønudbetalinger, som efter kuratellets opfattelse har været uberettigede,' lyder det.
Ifølge Ekstra Bladets oplysninger er der tale om Louisa Cocco Dalgaard, selvom det ikke fremgår direkte af redegørelsen.
Kuratorerne ønsker ikke at be- eller afkræfte, hvorvidt der er tale om håndlæser-hustruen.
Ekstra Bladet har spurgt både Louisa Cocco Dalgaard og Rasmus Bjerregaard om kravet, men ingen af de to er vendt tilbage på henvendelserne.
Bestyrelsesformand Torben Linnet Albrekt skriver i en mail:
'Det er en virkelig glædelig nyhed! Kurator og tillidsmand har gjort et godt stykke arbejde. Jeg er ikke blevet oplyst om, hvem dette krav er imod, men jeg formoder, at det er første krav ud af flere imod den adm. direktørs kone, Louisa Cocco,' skriver han og afviser, at han var bekendt med, at hun modtog løn fra Sinitone i flere år.
Kongeløn uden at arbejde
Ekstra Bladet har tidligere talt med Rasmus Bjerregaard omkring hustruens ansættelse.
Dengang fortalte han
, at hun udførte 'almindeligt arbejde' i selskabet, mens hun i øvrigt drev håndlæser-klinik fra Sinitones kontor i Roskilde.
Bestyrelsesformand Torben Linnet Albrekt afviste dog og fortalte, at 'hun på intet tidspunkt har været ansat eller haft indflydelse på virksomhedens drift.'
Hans forklaring bakkes tilsyneladende op af uafhængig revisor Elan Schapiro, som retten udpegede som tillidsmand, da Sinitone kort inden konkursen forsøgte at redde stumperne.
'Udbetalt løn til ledelsens nærtstående anses for ikke at være afholdt af erhvervsmæssige årsager,' kom tillidsmanden frem til.
Ekstra Bladet har tidligere gennemgået de tårnhøje lønudbetalinger til både Rasmus Bjerregaard, Torben Linnet Albrekt og Louise Cocco Dalgaard. De omtalte lønsedler kan du se
her
.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Håndlæserhustru måtte godt - andre måtte ikke
Man kan da sagtens have en bibeskæftigelse.
Sådan var forklaringen fra den fallerede direktør for høreapparatsfirmaet Sinitone, Rasmus Bjerregaard,
da Ekstra Bladet for nylig spurgte ham ind til
, hvad hans hustru, Louisa Cocco Dalgaard, havde lavet i firmaet for 75.000 kroner om måneden - og hvorfor hun på samme tid drev Coccos håndlæsning fra samme adresse.
Men det måtte de almindelige ansatte ikke bare. Det viser en ansættelseskontrakt, som Ekstra Bladet er i besiddelse af.
'Medarbejderen er i ansættelsesperioden forpligtet til at bruge al sin arbejdskraft i Selskabets interesse, og må ikke uden forudgående skriftlig accept fra Selskabets direktør hverken direkte eller indirekte deltage i andre forretningsaktiviteter, hverken lønnede eller ulønnede,' lyder det i kontrakten, der skulle skrives under på ved ansættelse.
Lukker ned
Allerede kort efter Ekstra Bladets første henvendelse til ægteparret valget Louisa Cocco Dalgaard at lukke ned for hjemmesiden Coccos Håndlæsning.
Indtil da havde interesserede følgere ellers haft mulighed for at læse, at hun var 44 år gammel og levede et helt almindeligt liv med mand og tre børn, ligesom hun i 2014 blev uddannet håndlæser på den islandske håndlæserskole ved Sigridur.
Siden stiftelsen af Sinitone har hun deltaget i samtlige af Sigridurs hold, fremgik det desuden.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Ejerne af Sinitone levede i luksus i tiden op til konkursen. Det vanvittige forbrug kan du læse meget mere om
her
, mens du
her
kan se deres vilde lønsedler.
Alle historier - Sinitone
body_en:
Do you know anything? Then write to the journalists behind the story
here
.
DKK 3,463,565.49.
That's how much Louisa Cocco Dalgaard has to pay back to the bankruptcy estate after Sinitone, if it's up to the trustees, who are currently trying to clean up the collapse of the hearing aid company. Ekstra Bladet can now reveal that.
Her husband, Rasmus Bjerregaard, was managing director and owned 70 percent of Sinitone, which is also known as Hørebil, which until bankruptcy ran mobile hearing clinics where you drove out to the customer, did a hearing test and delivered a hearing aid. Around the turn of the year, however, the company collapsed,
after the owners had lived in luxury
, and where Louisa Cocco Dalgaard
had himself received a huge salary
.
FACTS Sinitone's million-dollar collapse
Ekstra Bladet has obtained access to the latest report, which the two trustees, Christian Jul Madsen from Kromann Reumert and Henrik Selchau Poulsen from Bruun Hjejle, have sent out to those who believe they have money to their credit at Sinitone. Here it appears that:
'The trusteeship has provisionally sent a demand for payment of a claim calculated by the trusteeship of DKK 3,463,565.49, which is provisionally partially disputed by the debtor. The claim relates to salary payments which, in the curator's opinion, have been unjustified,' it says.
According to Ekstra Bladet's information, it is Louisa Cocco Dalgaard, although this does not appear directly from the report.
The curators do not want to confirm or deny whether it is the palm reader's wife.
Ekstra Bladet has asked both Louisa Cocco Dalgaard and Rasmus Bjerregaard about the claim, but neither has returned the inquiries.
Board chairman Torben Linnet Albrekt writes in an email:
'This is really good news! The curator and trustee have done a good job. I have not been told who this claim is against, but I suspect that it is the first of several claims against the CEO's wife, Louisa Cocco,' he writes, denying that he was aware that she received salary from Sinitone for several years.
Royal salary without working
Ekstra Bladet has previously spoken to Rasmus Bjerregaard about the wife's employment.
Then he told
, that she carried out 'ordinary work' in the company, while she also ran a hand reader clinic from Sinitone's office in Roskilde.
Chairman of the board Torben Linnet Albrekt refused, however, and said that 'she has never been employed or had any influence on the company's operations.'
His explanation is apparently backed up by independent accountant Elan Schapiro, whom the court appointed as trustee when Sinitone tried to salvage the pieces shortly before bankruptcy.
'Salary paid to the management's relatives is considered not to have been incurred for business reasons,' the trustee concluded.
Ekstra Bladet has previously reviewed the towering salary payments to both Rasmus Bjerregaard, Torben Linnet Albrekt and Louise Cocco Dalgaard. You can see the mentioned pay slips
here
.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
Hand reader's wife was allowed - others were not allowed
You can easily have a side job.
Such was the explanation from the failed director of the hearing aid company Sinitone, Rasmus Bjerregaard,
when Ekstra Bladet recently asked him about
, what his wife, Louisa Cocco Dalgaard, had done in the company for 75,000 kroner a month - and why she at the same time ran Cocco's hand reading from the same address.
But the ordinary employees just didn't have to. This shows an employment contract that Ekstra Bladet is in possession of.
'During the employment period, the employee is obliged to use all his labor in the interest of the Company, and may not, without prior written acceptance from the Company's director, either directly or indirectly participate in other business activities, whether paid or unpaid,' reads the contract that had to be signed on upon employment.
Shut down
Already shortly after Ekstra Bladet's first inquiry to the married couple, Louisa Cocco Dalgaard chose to shut down the website Coccos Håndlæsing.
Until then, interested followers had otherwise had the opportunity to read that she was 44 years old and lived a completely ordinary life with a husband and three children, just as in 2014 she was trained as a palmist at the Icelandic palmistry school at Sigridur.
Since the foundation of Sinitone, she has participated in all of Sigridur's teams, it also appeared.
--------- SPLIT ELEMENT ---------
The owners of Sinitone lived in luxury in the time leading up to the bankruptcy. You can read much more about the crazy consumption
here
, while you
here
can see their wild paychecks.
